-"I couldn't think of anyone else to work with..."-

Blake blushed a lot but quickly covered his face with a book, pretending to be reading, and he said in his mind 'What the hell is wrong with me?! Why do I feel embarrassed?'

-"Do you have anything to do after class?"- Joana said to him

-"...No...why?"- Blake answered slowly, to prevent stuttering, as he was feeling weird by Joana's attitude

-"Then we can go to my house to do the homework..."-

'HER HOUSE?!! Alright, Blake, calm down... it's not like you are her boyfriend or something.... WTF?!! Why am I thinking such a thing?! Anyway, as long as you are nothing beyond a friend, you're safe from her parents...' (Blake knew girls' parents usually went beast on their boyfriends, by watching when walking by, not that he really was watching, but some times the girls' fathers' shouts were simply too loud to be ignored...)

-"Blake... you look paler..."- Joana said worried, and Blake said frantically

-"Don'tworryit'snothingtoworryabout...."- He calmed down and added -"It was nothing, just stupid me..."-

Joana giggled, despite he said it seriously, it somehow sounded cute to her, and she realized (as anyone with 2% of brain would) that Blake was worried and blushing. However, she knew she was the one to worry about certain things...

The class continued for some more minutes and the bell rang again, Blake went to his locker, and was followed by Joana, whose locker was close to his. After they put away their stuff, they walked out of school...
15311111111.title: Back to Blake and Joana...

choices: Joana and Blake spend more time together...
153111111111.content:
Blake was walking next to Joana, but was paying more attention to where were they going, until he felt a hand grabbing his and pulling him. It had been Joana, and she said to him

-"We needed to go around this corner... you didn't hear me, did you?"-

-"I... I was trying to learn the way..."- Blake said, and Joana giggled, she added

-"It doesn't bother me taking you here..."- Again, Blake blushed and looked away, because in all this time she hadn't let go his hand. They walked for some more time (roughly 20 min) until they got in front of a really large mansion, and Joana opened the gate by dialing a password, while Blake stared with a O_O face

'Just my luck...' He thought, he was expecting a more normal house so his economic situation wasn't so noticeable, but to Blake, this wasn't just his day...

-"Well, here we are"- Joana said and entered, still pulling Blake by the hand, who had somehow forgotten about that, nor remembered, and whispered to her

-"Hey!! Don't you think...uh...that...well..."-

-"What is it?"- Joana asked, and Blake gulped

-"You're still holding hand... I don't think your parents would be too happy to see this..."- Blake said nervously, and scratched the back of his head with the other hand. Joana released his hand and blushed a bit, though Blake didn't notice

-"Sorry"- She said quietly, then after walking some more, they finally got to the house, Joana opened the door and they went inside

-"I'm home!!"- She said loudly, and a blonde woman came in, seemingly from her room, and greeted her, then she looked at Blake, who was standing a few feet behind.

-"Oh, hello! You must be Blake..."- She said, and Blake was rather surprised, but greeted back

-"Yeah... Hi..."-

-"Joana already told us about you. Thank you very much, I guess it's still difficult to be the new guys at school......"- She said to him, and then he realized that the woman was Joana's mom, despite she looks nothing like her. He also paled even more because he didn't really expect Joana to tell her parents about a guy she barely knows. Joana's mom noticed that Blake was very different from average guys, and his behavior was that of a shier one, despite his tougher look... also, he looked pale and unhealthy, as if he lived in poverty, then, she realized that Blake was intimidated by their lifestyle. She went back to her room, and Joana said to Blake

-"Umm... I guess I owe you a few explanations..."-

-"It's not necessary, if you don't want to..."- Blake said, but Joana replied

-"Yes, I want to. And I think you deserve to hear them, you didn't even know who I am when you saved me..."- She said, blushing a bit more -"Well, my father is a scientist, and does lots of different stuff, my mom runs the company that sells and distributes his technology... That's the short version..."-

-"I understand, no problem..."- Blake said, and thought 'Whoah... These people have CapsuleCorp* technology level...'

-"My dad may help us to do our homework..."- Joana said, and Blake nodded in agreement, thinking 'Now that I know he's a very brilliant scientist, it makes perfect sense...', and felt suddenly being dragged by Joana, who was dragging him by the hand, and took him to a laboratory

-"Are you sure I should be here? I don't want your father to be mad at us..."- Blake said, though he really meant "Me" instead of "Us", he also thought again that Joana was stronger than a normal girl for sure... could it be her father's doing?

-"Of course!! There are many computers and we can use them..."- Joana said as if it was an everyday thing, with a n_n face

They came in and Blake saw a black haired man, seemingly in his early thirties, typing in an impressive looking computer, one with 5 screens, and what looked like a huge CPU (Blake knows of computers, he repairs them as a job... didn't you wonder how an orphan managed to pay high school studies?). Joana greeted him, and he almost jumped of his chair. He quickly turned off the screens and greeted back at Joana.

-"What were you doing?"- She asked

-"Uh... A personal project..."- Her father said, rather nervous

-"Alright. Well, I got homework about sciences and I wondered if you can help us..."- She said, and he raised an eyebrow at her saying "us"

-"Blake will work with me"- She said, again, in a little too natural way from Blake's point of view.

-"Uh... hi..."- Blake said, not really knowing what to do, and both of them stared at each other with confused looks. Then Joana's father seemed to remember

-"I remember now!! So, you're the one who saved my daughter from those bullies?"-

-"Dad!!"- Joana was for the first time embarrassed by how her father stated facts, while Blake remained silent and shrugged

-"Some things never change... I hated bullies back when I was at school..."- Joana's father said, and remembered how many times he ended up beaten up, with his homework stolen, or forced to do others' homework, or simply getting beaten for the heck of it... That's why he learned martial arts when he was a teenager (more exactly at 17 years old)... -"They seem to sink lower each generation... the bullies of my time didn't attack girls at least..."- He muttered, then he said to Blake

-"I thank you personally. You have no idea how much trouble you saved Joana from..."- He said and sounded honest, although he thought 'He saved everyone of knowing Joana's real strength... and us from moving...'

-"...No problem..."- Blake said, once more unsure about what to say, though that answer seemed to be okay. Joana's father then said

-"Well, what's the topic of the homework?"-

-"Umm..."- Joana started checking her notes -"It's about hybrids and interbreeding..."-

-"What kind of topic is that?"- Blake asked

-"Actually, it's very interesting. When compatible species interbreed, their hybrid descendants are usually superior to both of parents' species. However, this behavior is highly unlikely in nature, and species aren't really attracted to different ones. To put it easy, a lion won't go with tigresses as long as there are lionesses..."-

-"Wow, that's just about half of the homework..."- Joana said, and was writing in her notebook

-"The results are impressive when done correctly. Back to my little example: A lioness + a tiger = a tigon... which is in fact slightly inferior to both species... but, a lion + a tigress = a liger, which is an enormous feline, obviously far stronger than the rest of natural species..."-

-"Aren't hybrids sterile?"- Blake asked

-"Not all of them. Usually hybrids are sterile because their parents have a different number of chromosomes, which makes a sort of a mess, let's say a hybrid's father was 78 chromosomes, and the mother has 80... given that the hybrid would inherit half of each, he'd end up with 79... and despite the hybrid advantages, it's a genetic mess... However, some hybrids can be perfectly normal if are the result of even more compatible species that happen to share their chromosome number..."-

-"That's impressive, but, isn't it still a bit unnatural?"- Blake asked again

-"Technically yeah... in terms of animals is easier, although they are attracted to their own species and only breed with others when there aren't others of their own. And still they seek a genetically closest as possible mate. In sentient beings, it's more complicate, given that there are emotions and free will, but still, their own species' opposite sex's pheromones have a stronger effect than other species'..."-

-"Alright. Thank you very much dad, I think this will do..."- Joana closed her notebook, and said to Blake

-"Would you like to have dinner with us?"-

-"What?! But... uhh... it's just 4:30 PM..."- Blake said

-"You can stay here until it's time..."- Joana replied, and Blake said

-"Won't your family be uncomfortable about dinning with a stranger?**"-

-"I don't see the problem... And I doubt Sarah would be bothered either..."- Joana's father said (Sarah is Joana's [adoptive] mother' name)

-"Well, if that's alright with you..."- Blake said, then a loud grumbling was heard, and Joana blushed slightly

-"Why don't you go get some snack? I have some more things to work on..."-

-"Sure"- Joana said, and dragged Blake again, grabbing his hand. Joana's father noticed this, he also knew that usually guys from her previous school attacked her a lot, and that she never had a friend before, but he expected a girl... also, Blake had an unhealthy look to himself...

*Since this is Dragon Ball Universe, I assume CapsuleCorp is a huge corporation in the technology area, but, who said it wouldn't have rivals?
** I know this may vary in other places, but unfortunately it's a negative common stereotype here. Some families won't eat no matter how hungry they are until visits are gone, and usually get mad when someone visits slightly before lunch/dinner time.
153111111111.title: Blake goes to Joana's house...

1531111111111.content:
Blake remembered that Joana was hungry because she gave him her lunch, so, he was thinking about how to get some food, and checked his wallet, which just had barely enough for another apple... 'I doubt just an apple would do for her...' He thought, and when he realized they were outside, there were many different trees, most of them with different fruits, also, he noticed that Joana was no longer next to him, and noticed that she was eating several fruits while on a tree's branch.

She gestured him to come with her, and he jumped to a nearby branch. This tree had a fruit unknown to Blake (I don't know what is supposed to look like, but it's similar to this: http://tinypic.com/view.php?pic=20tp8v6&... ). Blake had sen them but he had no idea what they were, he only knew that they were too expensive for him. Joana also told him to eat with gestures, and he did so... strangely... the fruit had a very similar taste to cooked meat, although with a lime-like touch. Also, it was way better as a food than Blake's everyday foods (which are both too poor in quality and in very small quantities)

Blake allowed himself to eat another fruit. He even felt his entire body functioning at 100%, and his muscles tightened for a brief moment, before going back to normal, something a bit weird but considering he had eaten a decent food in a very long time, he didn't pay attention to this. Unknown to him, Joana perceived this as well, and that he no longer looked pale after some minutes... which was weird... like all he needed was to eat more... she smiled, relieved that he didn't seem to be really sick...

After Joana and Blake were done (Blake didn't pay attention to how many fruits she ate), they jumped down from the tree, and Joana said

-"You hadn't eaten these fruits before?"-

-"...No... I have eaten nothing costing more than 100 zenny..."- He replied

-"100 zenny? What can you eat with 100 zenny?"- Joana was more worried than she thought she'd be

-"Precisely..."- Blake replied -"But it doesn't matter... I've been like that for my entire life, so, there's no problem..."-

-"No problem?! Blake, you can't just be used to that!!"-

-"It's not like I have a choice... I don't get too much money from my jobs and I need to pay electricity and other stuff as well..."-

-"We... I guess you're right..."- Joana said, she then said -"But I'll keep my promise, I'll bring lunch for you at least..."-

-"Joana, I don't want to sound mean, but let's be honest: Your family's lifestyle is way different than mine, and it's obvious I'm nowhere near yours... Do you really think your parents would give away free food to a stranger? Even if they do, it would be because of you, and they would be secretly mad at me, and I don't like that kind of help..."-

Blake said, and this time, Joana remained silent, she really wanted to help him. Then, after another uncomfortable silence, she said

-"Well... We've done most of the homework, do you want to check my notes?"-

-"I guess so"-

Blake and her went back to the living room and Blake started reading Joana's notes and writing in his own notebook. They didn't know that Joana's parents had heard most of the conversation, nor that they were watching them from the distance. Joana's mother (Sarah) asked to her husband

-"What do you think, John?"-

-"...Well... the boy doesn't seem to be the typical hormone driven teenager..."-

-"He seems a bit sensitive about being poor... I wonder how does he live like... But besides that, look closer..."- Sarah said, and John scratched his head in confusion

-"They're... doing homework? What's with that?"-

Sarah shook her head, and replied

-"It seems our girl likes him..."-

-"Huh?! What?!"- John was now even more confused

-"You're good in sciences, but you've always been dense to more personal things, silly..."- Sarah said, then she added, giggling -"But I liked that in you..."-

-"I have the feeling Blake doesn't know either..."- John said

-"Men..."- Sarah said, and laughed

-"But... what's she going to do about her..."- John wondered, but Sarah interrupted him

-"Tail?"-

-"...yeah... that and the rest of her other alien traits... like the amounts of food she eats... and her strength... but mostly the tail..."-

-"I'll talk to her about it..."- Sarah said, then she added -"...And you said she wouldn't like a human because of her being an alien..."-

-"I said she would be less attracted to humans because she's from a different species... unless..."- He started scratching his chin thoughtfully, and Sarah said

-"You better don't do anything that embarrasses or annoys her... You have that 'scientific' look..."-

-"...Alright..."- But he thought 'It's not really likely anyway, I mean... how can I believe the first guy Joana meets happens to be another alien?... meh...' However, he almost scolded himself mentally 'It wouldn't hurt to verify that!! You're a man of science, and anyway, if the boy is human, no damage will be done... unless they find out..."-

He noticed that his wife seemed to be happy about Joana. Now that he was focusing, he noticed her grabbing Blake's hand and giving him a warm look, although Blake didn't realize, he was focused reading and writing. Almost reading her husband's mind, Sarah said

-"You shouldn't be surprised, he's just as dense as you were back at high school..."-

-"Uh..."- John was caught in that point...

-"Well... let's leave them alone..."- Sarah said, and started to head for her room (not where they sleep, it's another room where she has some computers, papers and a phone, and where she works for most of the time)

-"If you say so..."- John said, and headed for his lab

In the mean time, Blake was using Joana's notes to make a better homework, normally, he didn't care too much about that stuff, but since he was a new guy, and almost everyone was trying to screw him up, he tried to do his best so he at least approved the classes... After some more time, he finished, and they watched some TV while they waited for dinner time...
1531111111111.title: Joana and Blake spend more time together...

15311111111111.content:
Blake felt somewhat sleepy, because that's the typical effect after eating, and Blake wasn't used to that, and after finishing his homework, he fell asleep without even realizing. Joana checked the notebook, and was surprised that Blake was smarter than she thought, and using all her notes he made a more detailed report. She smiled at him, and carefully moved him so that his head rested on her lap. She caressed his hair for a brief time, and watched television while waiting.

Sarah went to drink a glass of water and noticed what her daughter did, she also smiled, giggled silently, and went back to her work room. Some minutes later, Joahn came to see her, he decided stop working on his inventions for that day, and Sarah said

-"Have you seen our daughter?"-

He had a look out of the door, and noticed Joana watching the television with Blake laying in the sofa, his head resting on her lap.

-"That was quick... that guy has some guts..."- He said

-"Actually, he did nothing. He just fell asleep... It's understandable, he looked like he needed a lot of rest... But what I mean is that I was right, Joana likes him..."-

-"You still need to talk to her... she shouldn't raise her hopes very much... It's highly likely he's going to freak out if he ever finds out she's not a human... and if she isn't aware of this, it'll break her heart..."- John said

-"Don't be so pessimistic... what are the chances he finds out about her tail?"- Sarah replied

-"10% in the short run... but nearly 100% in the long run..."- John said

-"Why can't you just remove it surgically? I know you're perfectly capable of that..."-

-"We don't know enough about her anatomy... the tail is no mutation... and there must be some reason for it to be, maybe it's even vital, or removing it may have nasty side effects..."- John said -"You know that merely pulling or squeezing it causes her immense pain and renders her immobile..."-

-"I know... I didn't know a baby could cry like that before..."- Sarah said -"But I can't believe it's such a big deal..."-

-"The tail seems to be an important weak point, but also, it seems to absorb certain types of energy... Evolution doesn't give body parts for no reason..."-

-"Then... if this keeps going and at some point he asks her out, me may need to 'prepare' him..."-

-"Maybe, but only if this goes on... if he keeps things as just friends there's no problem..."-

-"I doubt Joana would like to stay in 'just friends'..."- Sarah said, and added -"I hated it when you wanted us to stay like that back at high school..."-

-"Whatever..."- John said, a bit embarrassed

Two hours and a half passed, and Blake woke up. he remembered falling asleep while sitting so he sat up very quickly, and gasped

-"Did you have a good sleep?"- He hard Joana's voice behind him, and turned around to see her, he also realized he had been sleeping on her lap. He backed away a bit and said apologetically

-"I... I am really sorry... I didn't mean anything... I fell asleep... I don't even know when did I..."-

-"It's alright. You don't need to apologize"- Joana said, blushing

-"Uh..."- Blake didn't know what to say, he expected her to be angry at him (he had noticed how many times girls slapped guys by almost anything, and sometimes for no reason, although the guys from Blake's previous school weren't precisely nice guys [Some of them study at the same high school as Blake, and all of them are troublesome, bully others, and have many bad behavior reports, this makes Blake a rarity among them, and he stayed neutral to most conflicts for most of the time, but he had to fight a lot to defend himself because even as neutral, many guys tried to pick on him, or take his lunch, or simply intimidate him...] ). Blake was also a bit afraid because she defeated the bully he stopped rather easily. Joana perceived this

-"You thought I was going to punch you, didn't you?"- Blake opened his eyes wide, very surprised because he didn't expect her to almost read his mind. Now that he had spent some time with her, he had sensed something different and strong in her, and he took it as a signal of her being a lot stronger than he thought, further keeping a warning about her...

-"Well... yeah..."- Blake decided to be honest

-"Why are you afraid of me?"-

-"I'm not really afraid of you, but afraid of what can happen..."- Blake started to explain, although there was something about her he was afraid of, but he decided not to tell this...

-"Huh?"-

-"In the school I studied before, there was only chaos, it was very essed up, and school authority never bothered to do anything. So, some groups attained dominance through intimidation, and there were many conflicts, and a very great deal of them were because of misunderstandings... I learned that guys who try to be too close to a girl get either kicked where it hurts the most, or slapped in the best case..."-

-"I'm not like those people. And I have no reason to hurt you, you're actually a nice guy..."- Joana blushed more when she said that, and Blake blushed as well, but despite he looked away, Joana still noticed it. They remained silent for a while, until Sarah (Joana's adoptive mother) called them for dinner...

Meanwhile, on the other side of the world...

Ivan had broken free a year ago, but he kept wandering around the vast and snowy siberian land, he hunted animals to eat, and drank molten snow, until he found a small city, which he destroyed easily. After having a really good lunch (obviously, he ate all the food he found in the stores, after killing people), he started walking again, his instincts were taking him to somewhere, but he didn't know. He walked a lot, until it was night, and a spaceship landed a few miles from him. Then, his instincts kicked in, and he dashed toward it.

A 16 years-looking boy got off from the spaceship. He had long white hair, and red eyes. He was wearing a white cloak over a gray shirt, and white pants. He also wore a blue scouter. This was an enhanced version of scouters, which was adapted by the Jigokujin after their war against the saiyans. These scouters had far more functions than Frieza's forces' or saiyans'. Also, they worked with neurological command. The guy started looking around, muttering

-"I can't believe they sent me to this waste of planet to track possible saiyans... They were killed by Frieza and us over 15 years ago, dammit!!"-

Then his scouter beeped -"Huh?"- He got a reading of a power level getting near, seemingly, heading toward him. He smiled -"Heh. This will be easier than I thought..."-

Ivan stood before the strange white haired guy and his ship. The white haired guy immediately noticed Ivan's tail, and started to clap his hands

-"Very good. I didn't expect such cooperation from you monkeys..."-

-"Who the hell are you?"- Ivan asked, he was starting to feel angry, to feel the urge to kill, to fight...

-"Call me Blaze..."- The white haired guy replied -"This will be fun..."-

Back to Joana's house...

The dinner went rather smoothly. As both parents were already aware, they said nothing about Blake, although he avoided answering personal questions because he didn't want to tell that he was a guy with no family and with very little money. Blake left after some more time, and Joana's parents decided to talk to her

-"Um... Joana..."- John started to say -"We've noticed what's going on here, and we need to talk to you..."-

-"What?"- She asked, she could't believe her parents could read her emotions with such ease

-"We realized that you may have... feelings... for that guy..."- Sarah said, a bit hesitant

-"You must be aware that you can't be too reckless about yourself, about some things, like..."- John said, but he was interrupted

-"Like my tail?"- Joana sounded sad

-"Yeah... any normal guy would kinda freak out if finds you have a tail, and it could be dangerous if they tell others..."- John said -"It doesn't mean you aren't a pretty girl, just that, as you know, you aren't human..."-

-"I know..."- Joana sounded even sadder -"But... what if Blake doesn't mind?"-

-"That'd be very nice, and you'd be very lucky if that was the case. But we should stay realistic..."- Sarah replied

-"Alright... I understand..."- Joana went to sleep, rather saddened by her talk with her parents.

-"It was better now than later..."- Sarah said, and sighed -"Though I feel bad for her. She's really pretty for a girl... it's just that tail..."-

-"Her appetite is also inhuman... only because she ate a lot of fruits it was possible she consumed a normal dinner..."- John said -"Although all of this is a little intriguing..."-

-"Why?"-

-"Joana nearly fell in love with that guy in just 2 days..."-

-"She's a girl, and she's at highschool, it's perfectly normal..."- Sarah said

-"Normally, girls start to develop crushes near 10 or 11 years, but Joana never did, until now..."-

-"What are you insinuating?"- Sarah was now intrigued as well

-"Nothing yet. But there are several suspicious facts that I need to verify. I'll tell you when I find something..."- He went back to his lab, after some minutes, Sarah thought 'I know what he's thinking, and it's completely absurd...'
15311111111111.title: Things start to go wrong... maybe...

choices: The women fight their way inside?
153111111111111.content:
Meanwhile, somewhere in Siberia, at night...

-"I won't tell you more, saiyan... I am here to kill you... and that's all you need to know..."- Blaze said, and quickly dodged a punch from Ivan. Blaze's scouter beeped several times, and it gave a more complete reading (Jigokujin had already scouter-like technology, but in non portable form factor, so, these scouters are more based on their own than on Saiyans', who seemingly obtained them from the Tuffles by the way), it said:

-"Species: Saiyan. Gender: Male. Age: Between 15 - 17. Additional info: Unstable power readings indicate this is probably Makotsu, a dangerously atypical saiyan. Son of another atypical saiyan, Broly, rumored to be the Legendary Super Saiyan. Threat level: Potentially highly dangerous..."-

-"Potentially dangerous? Bah!!"- Blaze said, and his scouter beeped again -"The power level is... 12,000? Not bad..."- Ivan roared furiously and punched him in the stomach, but Blaze didn't even move an inch. Ivan punched him several more times and kicked him, but Blaze just yawned in boredom. Ivan dashed backward and threw an energy ball at Blaze, which he deflected with only one hand (I would've written bare hand, but he was wearing gloves...). Blaze laughed and said

-"At least make my long travel worth it, you monkey..."- Then Blaze sighed, and said -"I'll play way less than my best..."- Then he cracked his knuckles and dashed toward Ivan, he seemingly disappeared and reappeared behind him, timing perfectly, punching Ivan in the stomach as he turned around. Then, Blaze grabbed him by the face and slammed him against the ground, Ivan kicked him and swiftly got up. He readied two energy balls (by the way, Ivan's attacks are somewhat of a yellowish green) in his hands, and dashed toward Blaze, this time, Blaze disappeared and reappeared above in the sky, just to be hit by both energy balls, which created a large explosion...

Ivan readied other two energy balls, but before he realized, Blaze appeared in front of him, and gave him a really bad beating, punching, kicking, and slamming him against the ground. Blaze ended the combo by punching him into a mountain.However, much to his surprise, Ivan didn't seem very damaged, and his power level was exactly the same. Ivan rushed toward him but Blaze dodged him and kicked him, causing him to crash into the ground. Ivan got up and wiped off the blood of his lips' corner.

Then Ivan shot a barrage of energy balls at an incredible speed, but Blaze wasn't harmed at all, and said in an annoyed manner

-"How disappointing... although, according to the data, the strongest saiyan warriors known besides Broly were just near or slightly above 10,000... I admit you maybe are stronger than them, but you won't have the chance to grow stronger!!"- Blaze was surrounded by a dark purplish aura, and punched Ivan with so much strength that he vomited blood. Then, he put his foot over the back of Ivan's neck, but he roared in anger and knocked Blaze off his feet, to follow with a lot of furious punches, although, Blaze apparently got damaged, but he healed back in no time, and even his scouter was intact, so, he regained composure, and grabbed Ivan by the throat, and punched him several more times before flying about 650 feet high, and punching him downward, he also added an energy blast, which exploded right after he crashed into the ground.

Blaze laughed maniacally, while watching the fire and smoke slowly dissipate. Ivan was damaged, and was laying down on the burned ground. Then, the clouds in the sky dissipated as well, and Ivan noticed the full moon (not intentionally). His heartbeats became faster, and stronger, and he felt everything in his body tightening. Soon, he lost conscience, and rose as a great ape. Blaze was really surprised, as he had never seen such a thing, and evidently, someone didn't do their research... His scouter beeped several times, and Blaze opened his eyes wide

-"The power level is... 120,000?!!"- Then, a warning appeared in the scouter, which said

-"DANGER!! Saiyans have the ability to transform into giant apes, and their power increases ten times... There are no known weaknesses..."-

-"And now you tell me you piece of junk..."- Blaze powered up, but his scouter kept beeping, and sent back to their planet a report:

-"DANGER!! Male saiyan detected in planet Earth!! Threat level: High... Power level: 120,000... Current situation: Engaged in battle against the Jigokujin prince... Power level: 92,000. Notes: High probabilities of defeat..."-

The message was sent, and although Blaze would've broken the scouter, it'd be an important handicap he couldn't afford by now. He started to charge up a beam with his right hand, as the now ape Ivan was far more powerful than him. he fired the beam, but Ivan neutralized it with a mouth beam. Then, he ripped off a piece of the ground, and threw it at Blaze, who couldn't dodge it due to its size, but kicked it back, further angering the beast, which shot fire at him, and while Blaze managed to dodge most of it, the fire caused some serious burns, which Blaze could still heal, he'd worry if it wasn't night...

(All Jigokujin have this healing factor, though it depends on each individual, the more powerful they are, the better and faster his healing will be. Also, their native planet has 4 large moons, and is always at night, and only one moon is visible at a time, except on some special occasions were two, three or all of them can be seen. Their moon cycles are identical to Earth's though. Thus, they are stronger when the sunlight is blocked, also, they're stronger when the weather is cold)

Blaze charged up for a longer time an energy beam with both hands, and fired it at Ivan, this time, causing some burns to his chest. He flew near his face and punched one of his eyes, but got swatted by one of his giant hands, and crashed into the ground. Before he could realize, the giant ape stomped on him. But it takes more to kill someone like Blaze, who managed to partially lift up Ivan's foot, and fired another beam, drawing blood from it. Quickly, he flew away from the giant ape's foot to hit his other ankle with two energy beams. Ivan groaned in pain and fell down. But he still managed to get up, despite limping, and Blaze fired another beam, which slashed Ivan's shoulder.

However, Blaze miscalculated the ape's reach, and Ivan grabbed him, and started to try to squeeze him to death, and despite Blaze's strength, he was turned into a boneless piece of meat. As soon as this happened, all of Blaze's bones and organs regenerated once again, which angered the ape. Blaze bit the ape's hand, which proved to be effective due to the Jigokujin's fangs. Blaze flew away and spat the saiyan's blood in disgust. Then, both f them rushed toward each other, and Blaze could connect a powerful punch in the back of the ape's neck, but, by reflex, the ape swatted him away with great force, and so, while Ivan fell unconscious, Blaze was too weakened to finish him off.

Also, Ivan hadn't lost the transformation yet. Blaze grabbed his left arm in pain, and everything inside him ached a lot. he wouldn't last much longer in such conditions, specially if the Earth's sun appears. Blaze ended up retreating to his ship, and while the ship took off, e noticed that the saiyan slowly reverted to his normal form. He promised himself to come back and kill that saiyan with his own hands...

Meanwhile, in Jigokujin's home planet...

Two human-looking women walked among the crowd. They had brown and black hair, which was very different from Jigokujin's typical white, platinum or gray. These women passed as tourists. One of them looked to be in her late 20's or early 30's, while the other looked like between 17 - 19. The older one had light brown shoulder-length wavy hair, while the younger one had black waist-length hair, wavy as well. Also, the younger one had darker skin, while the older one's was fair.

They sneaked into the Jigokujin palace, and spied on the king and the court.

-"My lord. We just got report of a saiyan detected in Earth!!"- A messenger said

-"I knew it!!"- Omega (the king) slammed his fist on the table -"Frieza thought all saiyans were dead except for the three ones working for him..."-

-"Your Majesty!! We had another encounter with the rogue saiyan known as Turles. He defeated our forces once again. His power level was reported to be near 20,000..."- Another messenger who had just come in said

-"20,000... That's not good... the strongest saiyans we've fought were just half as powerful..."- Omega said, and a screen showed images of the war that happened 16 years ago. It showed Kailan, Bardock and Yousei in separate sections. Omega added

-"These ones had a power of 11,200... 10,000... and 8,500..."-

-"May I remind you of this one?"- A noble said, and the screen added a 4th picture, showing a teenager Broly -"This one reached over 50,000, but was taken down by his own comrades... He was dangerous even for them..."-

-"This is what that weird clown was afraid of... Saiyans are becoming stronger..."- Omega said, then, he read the first report...
153111111111111.title: Ivan vs Blaze... Saiyan vs Jigokujin

1531111111111111.content:
-"Dammit!! My son found another atypical saiyan!!"- Omega shouted, and asked -"What's the progress of the battle?"-

-"The atypical saiyan was confirmed to be Makotsu... son of the another atypical saiyan known as Broly... He possessed a power of 12,000 but it suddenly rocketed to 120,000..."-

-"That damn monkey thing..."- Omega muttered, although his expression couldn't be seen, as he was inside a very thick armor, and his voice sounded machine-like. His red eyes glowed inside the helmet, and were the only thing visible inside it. Also, his hair was platinum and rose from the top of his helmet and reached his ankles (sort of a knight-like look). He wore a white cape over a silver armor, with some golden adornments, and a red Omega letter on his chest plate. By the way, Omega was larger than the average Jigokujin, who are human sized. Omega stood at 9'10" tall (3 meters).

The armor covered the totality of his body, and his gloves, also metallic, were shaped as claws. The metal this armor was made of was very rare and only found in this planet or in some Asteroids. It's far superior to the alloy Frieza and his forces wear. It's solid, but can stretch a lot, also, it can act as gum-like when taking strong hits, preventing cracking, although potentially, hits powerful enough can crack and shatter this metal. Though keeping this in mind, Omega's ancestor, who made the armor, which has been worn by all kings (instead of a crown) also implemented nanotechnology, which allowed the armor to repair itself.

Despite this, and his enormous power, Omega hasn't fought personally nor made a serious move to prevent Frieza from knowing about his abilities, as he showed himself to Frieza more as an equal than as a servant. The latter would lead to Frieza killing him off just like did to King Vegeta, although the war against them would be much longer and more violent.

-"That was what we needed to know..."- The woman said, and started to head for the ducts' exit

-"I thought Makotsu was Broly's son... what business would we have with him?"- The girl asked

-"Yes, but the planet they sent Makotsu is the same we're looking for. Now, let's go..."- The woman replied, and they left quietly. After some minutes, they reached their space pods and left into space, setting course for Earth. They'd arrive in slightly over a month...

Meanwhile, in Earth...

Two weeks passed in Earth. Blake hadn't gone to Joana's house again, and despite he tried to talk her out of it, she kept bringing lunch for him. Blake started to realize that she wasn't spending time with anyone else, also, that more guys glared at him, although he still didn't understand why, maybe because her family is rich?. While he and Joana were in some classes, a man came to the principal's office, after formal greetings, the man said

-"I'm here to notify you that one f your students has been found to not have any living relatives... His name is Blake..."-

-"Huh?"- The principal seemed a bit confused

-"We've been verifying the students' information, and when we tried to locate Blake's grandmother, it marked it as red, which meant that she was already dead, and it was verified that the death certificate was indeed legit. So, you have an underage student with no legal guardian. He needs to get one in order to keep studying... Besides the fact that this student registered at this school while the grandmother has been dead for 6 years..."-

-"I know... but, shouldn't you try to locate his parents..."-

-"I doubt we can. We don't have any sample of Blake's DNA, also, the grandmother was an adoptive one, she reported to have found the child. And the grandmother has no living family either..."-

-"If we forced him to get a guardian, wouldn't that rather mean Blake would be mistreated? I know a lot of children and teenagers don't get precisely nice treatment when adopted at late ages..."-

-"That's not our business. However, I have to add that Blake has been investigated for a few days after finding this, and it's obvious he lives alone. He also looks dangerously unhealthy. He started recovering just recently, but he still looks unhealthy..."-

-"I'll tell him to get a legal guardian then..."- The principal said, and the man left. The principal started checking all files related to Blake (which weren't many, given that it's been only two weeks)

The registering papers, nothing outside normal. However, when he checked his entrance test's results, he got 935/1000. Then he checked the school he came from, one that wasn't known to be nice, all other guys from that school were troublesome and labeled as bullies. Now the principal was a bit intrigued. He also knew that less than 10 people got results above 800, and Blake's was in fact the third highest. 'This guy can be a good student. He deserves a chance...' He thought, and decided not to tell anything, luckily, the man wouldn't come back to check. Usually these notifications weren't further verified, although some students got expelled because of that, but only when they were troublesome or with low notes, which meant they couldn't justify their staying. But Blake's was justifiable...

He also checked the medical reports (There was a medical checkup the 2nd day of classes), which reported:
" Name: Blake.
Age: 16.
Stature: 180 cm
Weight: 55 kg
Reflexes: Faster than average, but nothing outside normal
Blood Test: He refused to have it.
Pulse: 140 bpm
Respiratory Rate: 8 per minute
Additional Notes: He looks extremely unhealthy. His skin is pale, and his look evidences he has some form of anemia, weighs 15 kg less than he should. His heart rate is abnormally high, and his respiratory rate is dangerously low. It is needed to talk to this student's parents as soon as possible."

-"Now that makes sense... though, why would he refuse a blood test? Maybe he has some illness and doesn't want to tell anyone... It is really sad guys like this one aren't taken care of. I'll tell Blake about the guardian thing as a recommendation..."-

He also found P.E class report, he checked it. It stated average, except for two individuals with higher physical performance than average: a girl called Joana... and Blake... The principal was surprised, as this seemed to contradict the medical report...

"Report on Blake, student number 006: He has higher physical performance than the rest, despite his looks. Thin for someone his stature, by the way. He can jump higher and longer distances than the rest. He had no problem climbing the rope, and can also run very fast. However, his stamina is ridiculously low. He was barely able to complete the first lap, and he couldn't continue after that. He looks like being ill or something."

-"Well, it sorta makes sense... though I'd expect Blake to be weaker by what the medical report said..."-

Meanwhile, Blake and Joana had finished their class, and despite Joana tried to invite Blake to her house again, he said he had a job to do, and left quickly. Joana sighed in sadness and walked to her house, alone another day... She couldn't get Blake to go with her anywhere outside school after the team homework, which got an A. She wondered if she screwed it up that badly that time. Blake wouldn't go to the movies, nor anywhere else. He agreed to go with her almost wherever at school, but outside, he seemed desperate to get out, always with a not-so convincing excuse...

Back to Siberia, Ivan took the two weeks to fully recover, and he could do so by destroying another town, and eating all of the food during his stay. And despite he didn't get stronger, his instincts became more powerful after that fight, and he felt that he needed to go somewhere, to kill someone. He felt the urge of going somewhere across the ocean, and to kill someone. He remembered that Blaze called him "Saiyan" and after remembering it, it echoed in his mind, and he roared very angrily, despite there was nobody to hear it. Ivan shouted

-"SAIYAAAN!!!!"- And flew towards the ocean, following just his instincts
1531111111111111.title: Blake doesn't have preciselt the best luck...

15311111111111111.content:
Blake's status was between very bad and bad. And the principal, who bothered in watching him at certain hours, noticed that he also had no friends except for one girl that kept following him around for most of the time, and despite he didn't mean to meddle in Blake's personal life, he noticed that the girl brought him food, and constantly tried to get him to go to her house more often. Blake avoided it every time with some excuse. He also seemed to avoid anything that implied them being outside of school.

The principal wondered if it could be related to Blake's condition. However, he knew it wouldn't be right to spy on him, so, he decided to talk to him. But as the last class ended, it'd have to be postponed to the next day. The principal observed that many guys were hostile toward Blake, and the only logic cause was that he was friends with the girl. (Though Blake himself didn't realize of this yet).

When Blake went to put away his school stuff, a bully called Albert said

-"Hey, Blake..."-

-"What is it, Albert?"-

-"It's been said that you're going out with that girl Joana..."-

-"Rumors..."- Blake said while putting away his books, but Albert shut the locker rather roughly, and said in an angrier tone

-"It's obvious that there's something between you two, and none of us agrees. A rat like you isn't worth that girl..."-

-"I'm not going out with her. And I thought girls were people, not objects anyway..."-

Albert punched the locker next to Blake's, denting it, and said

-"You're lying!! And that kind of loser talk is what girls always seem to like..."-

-"I'm not interested in going out with anybody. Nor I have money to pay a date, you already know that..."-

-"Funny thing is that she's rich!! She can pay that and more!! That's why all the other guys including me want to try our chances..."-

-"As I said. I don't care... I'm not interested in Joana, nor I'm interested in competing..."- Blake opened his locker again

-"I can't believe how easily you lie. It's obvious you want her for yourself!!"-

Blake just sighed, and Albert added

-"You want to live the great life, don't you? It's obvious she's your ticket for getting out of your misery!!"-

-"Actually I'm used to misery... And I wouldn't fit in rich people's world anyway. Do as you want, as long as it's not threatening or hurting her..."- Blake said, as he finished putting away his stuff

-"Or else?"- Albert laughed at what Blake said -"Are you telling me the limits of what I can do?"-

-"Regarding Joana, yes. She's still my friend, and I won't hesitate to kick your or anybody's ass if you mess with her..."- Blake said, crossing his arms

-"That's it!!"- Albert tried to punch Blake, who stopped his fist with one hand. Unknown to him, both Joana and the principal had seen and heard everything (from different positions, none of them were aware of each other). Blake said

-"You already know I can mop the floor with your face if I want to..."- Albert roared in anger and tried punching and kicking Blake at a very fast speed, but Blake dodged every hit. However, Blake panted a few times to regain his breath, and punched Albert hard in the stomach twice, then, he kicked him away, sending him against the lockers. Blake then started to walk away, but Albert got up and tried to attack Blake again, this time, Blake could only dodge some hits, and got punched and kicked when he ran out of breath.

Albert punched Blake in the stomach and slammed his face on the floor. He said -"I've seen your weak point, Blake. Your pathetic stamina..."- Joana and the principal opened their eyes wide, the former was more surprised than the later, but the principal was still surprised because that medical condition was being used against him. He was about to intervene, but noticed that Blake kicked upward, hitting Albert's jab, and got up swiftly, although he was breathing heavily. Albert said

-"Why do you bother protecting her, Blake? You've just known her for... 2 weeks?"-

-"You've said it already, Albert. I am a despicable rat. But she still offered me her friendship..."-

Albert rushed toward Blake again, and Blake connected some more strong hits on him, but Albert managed to slam him against the lockers and started to smash his face against them. Despite the pain, Blake laughed, and Albert asked angrily

-"What's so damn funny?!!"-

-"Everyone says I'm a rat, but you're worse than me..."- Albert got angered by this and smashed Blake again against the lockers, which got stained with Blake's blood, as he was at least smashed 5 times before the principal decided to intervene, however, much to his surprise, someone moved very fast and tackled Albert. It was Joana... She was looking very angrily at Albert, and punched him in the stomach with so much strength that it knocked the air out of him, and he fell unconscious. Blake noticed Joana's suddenly saddened look, and he said

-"How... long... have you... been here?"-

-"I saw and heard everything..."-

-"Oh..."- Blake said very quietly

-"What does that mean?"-

-"That I've realized how much you hate me now..."- Blake struggled to get up, refusing help from Joana -"It's okay. Everyone does. It was weird enough you didn't for a while. Don't worry, I'm used to that... now, I need to get going..."- Blake started to walk away, but he couldn't even walk two steps before coughing up blood, and falling to the floor again. He was breathing heavily, and noticed Joana was staring at him, although not with the hateful look he saw in everyone else, in fact, there were tears forming in her eyes... although Blake couldn't understand why. Then Joana ran toward him and knelt by his side, she let her tears drop, and said

-"How can you say that I hate you?!"-

-"Uh... well... I thought you would because I didn't word properly what I said... *cough!* I'm just another idiot..."-

-"Blake..."- Joana's voice faltered, and shed more tears -"I don't hate you... I... I..."- Joana hesitated to continue, and Blake got unconscious. She lifted him up and carried him on her back. The principal, who was too surprised to even move, was further surprised by seeing that Joana lifted Blake up rather easily, and carried him on her back with no problem, despite that technically, Blake weighs less than Joana. She left the school carrying Blake on her back, and didn't mind that some people saw her. Despite her family's reputation and her high notes, she never cared about what people would think of her.

Also, seeing that this happened because many guys were envious of Blake for being with her, with this, she tried to leave a clear message, that she wasn't interested in other guys. She even glared at some guys who were giving angry looks at the unconscious Blake... Eventually, she took him to her house, and her mother gasped when she saw her carrying a very wounded Blake. She first checked on Joana, asking worriedly

-"What happened? Are you ok?"-

-"I'm fine. Blake was attacked by a guy..."- Joana laid Blake on a bed in one of the guest rooms. Sarah called her husband, and when he came, he opened his eyes wide when seeing Blake, unconscious, and bleeding. He asked

-"What happened?"- Then he looked at Joana, and said -"Did you...?"-

-"NO!!"- Joana cried a bit

-"I didn't mean that... I meant... did he try to do something to you?"-

-"NO!!"- Joana sounded angrier, and she said, while crying -"He was attacked by a guy, because of me... because the guy was jealous of him being my friend..."- She cried some more, and said -"I told you, Blake isn't like the others. He was willing to defend me despite he didn't know I was watching and hearing him. He fought that guy despite feeling bad..."-

-"Uh... alright... Sorry"- John said, then he added -"Well, let's take him to my lab so I can check his condition..."- Joana carried Blake again, and laid him on a bed in the lab. John took a sample of Blake's blood, and also, connected some machines to him to check his vital signs. Soon, the machines were frantically beeping and making any sound they were programmed to in case something was wrong. He, Joana and his wife were all surprised when seeing that he had a heart rate of 45 bpm, and was breathing 6 times per minute. Sarah asked

-"Correct me if I'm wrong, but I thought the lower limits on normal people were 60 bpm and breathing 12 times per minute..."-

-"Indeed... No wonder he's so weakened... but at the same time, it's incredible that he's strong enough to withstand such a bad health..."- John said -"I'll check what's in his blood..."-

Joana was sitting in a chair, next to him, and Sarah was standing near Joana. She noticed that her daughter was very worried about this guy, and that there should be something wrong in his life... 2 hours later, John came with the results.
-"Everything is wrong... He has just 35 units of sodium, 0.5 of potasium, and 15 of blood sugar..."- John sighed and said -"These values are insanely low..."-

-"What are the normal values?"- Joana asked

-"The lowest healthy normal values are 136 of sodium, 3.5 of potasium, and 70 of blood sugar..."- John said -"Although that doesn't apply to you..."-
15311111111111111.title: Things get complicated for Blake...

153111111111111111.content:
-"What are we going to do?"- Joana asked, more worried

-"He also has 3 times more platelets, red and white blood cells a normal person would have... And since he seems to have lived like this for who knows how long, I bet he can heal, he just needs to rest, however, he'll need parenteral nutrition... and for good measure, someone should keep an eye on him..."- He knew Joana would do it without even being asked to. So, he set up the PN and left for a while, his wife followed him. Joana watched the vital signs on the machine, and wondered how was it even possible Blake lived like that...

-"Sarah, you may not believe me, but I'm sure there's something inhuman in that boy..."- John said, after getting far enough to not be heard by Joana.

-"Again with that?!"-

-"You saw it!! He's been living with less than 1/3 of the minimal living requirements. There's no way even the toughest martial artist would withstand such a bad health..."-

-"Maybe it's just some disease or a genetic thing..."- Sarah replied

-"I'm not saying he's the same alien type as Joana... he might be an entirely different species... although his blood values are at a midpoint, they're lower than Joana's, but are far superior to normal humans..."-

-"And the next thing you're going to say is that Earth suddenly became the Universe's daycare center, huh?"- Sarah said, crossing her arms

-"That attitude kept mankind stuck for 500 years in ignorance during the Middle Age..."-

-"I believe there would be certain advanced life form somewhere in space, but I don't think they'd look like us nor that they sent their children here... I mean, what reason could make a mother send her child to an unknown planet?"-

-"Our concept of family may not apply in other civilizations..."-

-"Maybe. But my point is that I don't think that boy is an alien. We know and accept Joana is one, and besides that strange sphere where she came from, we have nothing else that tells us about what kind of world she came from... But seriously, it's not possible that two aliens ended up in this same planet..."-

-"Science will answer this question. I still have some of his blood, and I'll use the computers to compare it with Joana's, although it'll take some time..."- John said, while Sarah facepalmed herself. Then she said

-"He doesn't even have a tail..."-

-"Correction, we haven't verified he hasn't a tail..."-

-"If your crazy theory is right, what if he got his tail removed and doesn't even know he's alien?"-

-"If he got his tail removed, that may explain his bad health..."- John said -"Maybe it's a consequence of having it removed by whoever who raised him, thinking it was a mutation or something..."-

-"And if he's so conveniently the same alien species as Joana, what would that mean for them?"- Sarah asked again

-"Well... it'd explain why she likes him..."-

-"I don't know why but I have the feeling that you want alien grandchildren..."- Sarah said, and John blushed in embarrassment

-"Dreaming costs nothing..."- John said -"Although... if sexual dimorphism is the same as in humans, he would be even stronger than Joana..."-

-"By how badly beaten he got from a bully who is not obviously another alien, I don't think so..."- Sarah said

-"Well, the computers will answer this question. I'll go check on him..."- John went back to the lab...

Meanwhile, in the lab, Blake woke up, and much to his dismay, he was attached to several electronic devices and they were injecting some stuff into his veins. He feared that Joana found he was an alien and reported him to government, and instinctively, tried to get up, but he heard Joana's voice.

-"Please, don't move. You're very wounded..."-

-"Where am I?"- Blake asked

-"In my dad's lab. I don't know where you live and you needed medical attention anyway..."-

-"I'm fine..."- Blake replied

-"Nope. The machines don't say so, and your blood test results were terrible..."-

-"Blood test?!"- Blake was now really worried.

-"Yeah, my dad needed to check it and your nutrients are very low..."-

Blake froze as he thought 'Dammit!! If they haven't seen I'm not human they will in to time... I'll have to destroy this laboratory and get the hell away from this place!!'

-"There are things I need to do, and I can't stay here, so, thanks for everything, but I'm going to..."- Blake tried to get up but Joana prevented him from doing so, and despite he was trying his best, Joana seemed to be stronger than him. Blake then said

-"You can't force me to stay here!!"-

Joana saddened again. She didn't know why he was so eager to leave, and what could be so bad about her or her family that Blake didn't care abut his own health as long as he could leave. Blake was still struggling, then he said

-"I can't tell you what, but something bad it's going to happen if I stay here..."-

-"Why? We're trying to heal you..."-

-"I can't be healed. I've been always like this... It's something nor me nor you can't understand..."- Blake said, still struggling to get up. Some of his wounds reopened and he stopped struggling, and writhed in pain. Joana's father came in, and noticed this, and asked what happened, Joana was about to answer when Blake said it was just a wound that reopened. But he also added that he needed to go, then John said

-"You're in no condition to leave. Everything in your body is screaming for medical attention... And I need to to a full physical checkup"-

-"What?!!"- Blake was surprised, however, he was relieved, as he knew that they hadn't found he had a tail... yet...

-"Don't worry. I'm a professional..."-

-"I don't want to be checked..."- Blake said -"And I won't explain the reasons..."- John sighed

-"Alright... I can't force you..."- 'Although it seems a bit suspicious... what would he not want me to see... a tail, maybe? or some other alien trait?' John's scientific mind wondered. Then, he told Joana to get a glass of water for Blake, and after she left, he said

-"Listen. I can't really explain what's going on, but my daughter cares a lot about you. I won't force you to anything, but I ask you to stay until you're in better health. Not for you, not for me, but for her... She wouldn't be in peace with herself if she knew you left while being in this condition..."- Blake sighed deeply, and said

-"Alright... But I don't want you to make any analysis on me or my blood..."-

-"Huh?"-

-"I know that you took a blood sample from me. Well, I don't want it to be analyzed..."- Blake said

-"Why?"-

-"Personal reasons. Something my grandma taught me... so, please give me back the sample..."-

John was somewhat surprised that Blake was firm and was determined to keep whatever it was in his body hidden. This only added more suspicion on the theory about him not being human. However, John was smarter, and said

-"I can't. I've already used up the sample to get the levels of blood sugar and blood cells..."-

Blake sighed, apparently in relief. And John smiled inside his mind. However he was now afraid that the results of whatever he found might change everything, and as he was considering the most likely variables and scenarios, he wondered what kind of damage may come from knowing about the secrets in Blake's DNA... But he wouldn't know until he tried, and as a scientist, he was a bit too stubborn to give up without investigating.
153111111111111111.title: Continue...

choices: Still, Blake decided to leave later...
1531111111111111111.content:
Meanwhile, John, who had one more blood sample (He had taken 3 but has already used 2), took half of it and poured it into another tube, which he inserted in a slot in what looked like a very complex machine. He gave a voice command

-"Analyze this sample and compare it with Joana's blood and DNA data..."-

-"Affirmative. The comparing process will be complete within exactly 6 days..."-

-"6 days?!!"- John didn't expect it'd take that long

-"In order to determine any similarities, the DNA must be thoroughly analyzed, and also the genetic patterns must be checked in order to tell if this individual is from the same unidentified alien species. Also, since our data bank consists of only one known specimen, comparison will take longer because it needs to take on account the individual genetic differences..."-

-"Alright..."- John mumbled, somewhat unhappy to have to wait so long. With the rest of the blood sample, he ran some more tests to find what's wrong. Nothing indicated a particular liver or kidney failure. He needed a new blood sample to know if there was some change in his blood, but he knew Blake would refuse. So, he decided to speak to him now that he was with Joana.

-"Blake... I know that you said you'd refuse to have more blood samples taken, but I need a fresh one to try to find out what's wrong, why you aren't improving..."-

-"It doesn't matter. But I won't have more of my blood taken..."- Blake said, Joana had a very worried look, John sighed, and said

-"Blake... what's the worst thing I could find? A disease? Drugs?"- He knew that at least the second one was false, but was trying to get Blake to at least accept despite telling nothing. However, Blake quickly detached all machines from his body and stood up, putting back on his shirt and jacket (His jeans and socks were never taken off in the first place). Then he said

-"Yeah!! Drugs!! I'm a damn drug addict!! That's why I told all of you that my condition is normal!!"- Blake then ran off, putting as much as strength in each stride, still, his heavily damaged body didn't got too far. He didn't even make it outside Joana's house (or mansion, whatever you want to call it), as he fell face first to the ground again, all his muscles ached in deep pain, and could no longer respond to Blake's command.

-"Joana, I don't know about you, but I have the feeling that what he said was not true..."- John said

-"I thought you'd actually believe him... I think he lied too..."- Joana didn't understand why Blake seemed so paranoid, speaking of which, Blake also coughed up a lot of blood, as this great effort reopened many hidden wounds inside Blake. Despite the immense pain he was suffering, he managed to stand up again, and tried to keep walking, although he fell down again in less than 4 steps. He fell unconscious once again...

When he woke up, he noticed he was in the lab again. He'd expect to be tied or something, but surprisingly, Joana was just sitting next to him, with a very worried and sad look, John was doing tests with another sample of his blood. He sighed in defeat, and remained silent. John then came in with a worried look as well

-"You've had no improvement. It's getting worse, and the parenteral nutrition has done nothing at all..."- John also added -"Also, there was no strange substance found in your blood... no drugs..."-

Blake growled in further defeat, however, for an unknown reason, Joana's presence soothed him. However, he was very aware about his life being in danger. John then said

-"I don't know what's going on... but you need more help, Blake. Your blood test indicated that you've been living under insanely low life conditions for a very long time. You might get long term damage if we don't stop whatever it's causing it..."-

-"Blake..."- Joana said, very worried and almost crying. She's known him just for 3 weeks, but he was her only friend, and she was developing feelings for him...

Time passed, and Blake's condition hadn't changed. John didn't know what to do (while keeping the assumption that he was human, which he was seriously doubting by this moment). Meanwhile, Joana bandaged some of his wounds, despite Blake's reluctance. He got his shoulders, arms, forearms and torso bandaged. John seriously wondered about Blake's condition. He also knew that if this guy died, Joana's heart would be broken in a far worse way. Also, despite his actual attitude, he seemed to be more innocent and nicer than many other guys.

Blake eventually fell asleep, as his body was exhausted, damaged, and struggling to live. Joana held his hand while he was sleeping, and John noticed this as well, although he said nothing. He already knew (because his wife told him) about her feelings for him. Also, the fact that he was willing to defend her was something that drew John's attention regarding this matter, many guys wouldn't bother fighting other guys just for a friend they aren't interested in.

Joana also fell asleep when more time passed, and John increased the parenteral nutrition dose to twice the quantity for a normal human at their worse state. He went for a coffee, and when he came back, he noticed that there was some improvement in Blake's condition. He took another blood sample, as Blake was too tired to even feel the needle. This blood sample showed Blake's blood with near human levels of chemical substances, although his heart and breathing rate were still lower than a normal person's.

-"This is extremely weird. I'm sure any person would've died with such a high dose... Now, I'm completely sure Blake has either some genetic syndrome or is just not plain human..."- However, he wouldn't be able to confirm neither theories until the analysis was finished, which would take 6 days..."-

Somewhere else, in space...

Through scouter communication, the black haired saiyan girl said

-"Mom... I'm hungry..."-

-"Me too. Let's stop in the next planet..."- The brown haired saiyan girl answered. In an hour they landed in a planet that resembled Earth, although with different shaped continents. They immediately sought food, and they ended up entering a city inhabited by human-looking aliens. When they noticed their armors, the men prepared to fight using arm blasters, while the women and children started to run away. The saiyans' scouters revealed that these aliens' power levels ranged from 10 - 25. And the energy blasts were harmless to them, and stood still while rolling their eyes, annoyed. After some minutes, the men ceased the fire, and the black haired saiyan girl said

-"In case you haven't noticed yet, we could've destroyed all of you with no effort if we really wanted to. We just came here for some food..."-

The men stopped the attack and most of them went back to their normal activities, although they were still worried about them, their armors and scouters were associated with Frieza's forces, which hadn't conquered this planet yet. The two saiyan women ate a lot of food at a restaurant, and given their power, none of the aliens dared to tell them to pay for the food. Some of the aliens who were inside this restaurant didn't hear or see what happened outside, and were talking normally, and it was heard

-"Hey, did you hear the latest news? It seems that the saiyans weren't fully extinct after all..."-

-"Saiyans? The people that transforms into monkeys?"-

This angered slightly both saiyan women, and despite they were seen as a potential threat, they were thought to be Frieza's soldiers, none of the aliens noticed their tails wrapped around their waists.

-"Yeah. The Jigokujin have been looking for them to destroy any remaining saiyan alive. They found one at some primitive planet called Earth..."-

-"And how did you get to know such information, I'm sure it would be top secret..."-

-"Someone leaked the reports..."-

-"I see. Is there more about it?"-

-"Well, besides the fact that both Frieza and the Jigokujin feared them, they also said that the saiyan found on Earth was so powerful he defeated the Jigokujin prince. Although, unless we develop something effective against such enemies, either the saiyans, Jigokujin or Frieza's empire will still be a problem for us..."-

-"How strong do you think Abakku is by now?"- The black haired saiyan whispered to her mother

-"...I don't know..."- The brown haired saiyan woman replied -"He was born with 1820. So, he can't be any lower than that. I can't tell how strong would he be..."-

-"Well... we're going to find out soon, right?"- The saiyan girl said

-"Yeah... in a week..."- The saiyan woman replied, and after finishing their food, they left, and in little time they were back at their saiyan pods, then they left the planet and headed for Earth once again...

Back to Earth...

Blake woke up the next day, after the slight improvement in his condition. He felt better than usually, but John told him he was not healed yet. He noticed that Joana was there too, and Blake asked

-"I thought we had classes today..."-

-"You aren't in condition to go, and I've been worried about you, if I went I'd be distracted anyway..."- Joana replied
1531111111111111111.title: Continue...

choices: Blake goes to the principal's office...
15311111111111111111.content:
-"Whatever..."- Blake replied

-"Finally you've gotten a little better, although your healing is far from done yet..."- John said, he noticed Joana got happier when hearing this.

-"Doc, I'm no science man, but I know my own body better than anyone else. My condition won't get past this..."- Blake said

-"We can't know until we try..."-

-"Well, let's make a bet. If I'm still like this by Sunday, you'll let me go..."- Blake said, John and Joana had raised eyebrows at such a bet, specially because not many people would refuse a free treatment for whatever disease or illness they had.

-"Alright..."- John said, shaking Blake's hand, like typical men doing a bet. Joana immediately exclaimed

-"Dad!!"-

-"I'm sorry, but I can't just force him to stay as long as we want to. Although a bet would be something to respect... I doubt you'll understand that, it's a men's thing..."- John replied, as he really knew that usually men were bound by these non-written rules. He also knew that he may have a chance at winning if he increased the nutrition dose,
until...

-"HOWEVER... No new treatments... To make this bet valid, everything will be kept as it's being done now..."- Blake said, and memorized the levels on each machine. John had a mental 'D'oh!' as he realized his plan may not work after all...

-"Alright..."- John mumbled, he hoped the current treatment worked, not only for his scientific curiosity but for Blake's well-being, since he was Joana's only friend, he appreciated him more than just a mere stranger, also, the fact that he hadn't acted, nor seemed to act like a perv earned him bonus points on this.

The weekend passed, and while Blake's condition improved very slightly, it was not enough, and Blake won the bet, although Joana insisted on that he should stay, to which Blake replied that he was fine, and that he could stand a mere discomfort (Though he's putting it very lightly, as in reality, Blake felt very tired, with low stamina and always body pain, but since he was taught to hide his non-human nature, he'd prefer it over being a lab-rat for the government...)

After Blake left, John said to his adoptive daughter

-"You better keep an eye on him... his body can collapse at any moment. I don't know how long will he last in such condition but something tells me it won't be for too long..."-

Joana nodded, and went back to her room, with nothing else to do... Then Sarah came in, and had heard everything

-"I know that look. You still think that there's something else about that guy..."-

-"Yeah. But I need 3 more days to prove it..."-

-"What do you gain by proving he's an alien? You'll sentence the poor boy to be experimented on by the government..."-

-"Who said I'm going to tell the government?"- John said

-"Well... it's the obvious choice by almost everyone..."-

-"I didn't mean harm, it's just that I need to know. Also, if he cooperated he could help me to expand and improve my research on Joana's species..."-

-"Why are you so sure he'd be the same species?"- Sarah asked (Although not being scientific-level smart, she has a lot of knowledge due to spending so much time with John)

-"There are some hints... His blood values were at a midpoint between Joana's and humans'... but his condition improved only after I changed the parenteral nutrition dose to twice..."-

-"Wasn't that fatal for anyone?"-

-"Exactly..."- John said, scratching his chin -"And you know... Joana's species seems to have a very high caloric demand... I guess that her immense strength and speed don't come from thin air... But the point it, that Blake's condition improved after getting a superior income of nutrients into his body, thus..."-

-"He needs to eat more?"- Sarah said, and John blinked twice in confusion, then his eyes illuminated and exclaimed

-"That's it!! That was the solution to Blake's problem!! Dammit... Why weren't you here 10 minutes ago?!"-

-"I realized of the obvious... why, what were you thinking before I said what I said?"-

-"That the nutrition dose may be a proof of Blake's alien nature..."-

-"Maybe if you had been more focused on healing him than on proving his species you'd have realized yourself..."-

-"Duh..."- John knew of this flaw, that his "knowledge hunger" blinded him from obvious facts often...

The next day, Monday...

School was normal, and by lunch time, Joana brought more food for Blake, who started to feel bad about getting food for free... Also, he had noticed that the hostile looks toward him increased even more than before... And something inside him was telling him that something may have happened the day he missed class (Friday). Joana interrupted his thoughts

-"Blake... I don't want to annoy you... but... I think you should let my dad help you... You don't look good..."-

-"Meh... I have never looked good...."- Blake answered in a careless manner, and Joana looked down, she didn't like very much Blake's low self steem, nor his carelessness about his own health. But more than disliking, it saddened her, and Blake failed to notice this.

-"Well..."- She said, after a short uncomfortable silence -"How about hanging out after school? I promise I won't annoy you anymore..."-

Blake would have simply said 'Sure' (Completely unaware of what Joana meant) but the looks of many people around made him gulp, and he said

-"Uh... I would like to, but... I just remembered I have something to do..."-

-"What? You said you live alone and you have not much to do after school..."-

-"Well... yeah, that's true..."- Blake started to laugh nervously, and Joana got the hint, and looked around discreetly, she noticed many guys glaring at Blake 'So... a non-spoken threat...' She sighed, thinking 'I'd wish Blake told me his problems rather than making up excuses...' Then, she remembered she had two tickets for a movie's premiere, she got them as a gift at the mall a week before school started, and at that time she had no idea of what to do with the second ticket, but now she had...

In a surprising move, she grabbed one of Blake's hand, and asked

-"So?"-

-"Huh?!"- Blake was really nervous, and blushed madly at Joana holding his hand, but more of his redness was because of the fear of the many guys wanting to beat the life of of him right now... Even when he was stronger than average people, Blake's health and low stamina meant he would lose a fight that lasted over 3 or 5 minutes, or against several guys...

-"Uh... Joana... I'm gonna get in trouble..."- He said, thinking 'I'm screwed anyway...'

-"Trouble? Do you mean those guys?"-

Then suddenly many of the guys went back to do their regular lunch time activities almost innocently, and Joana whispered to Blake

-"I have a plan to take care of them. You just don't do anything..."-

-"Alright... but..."-

-"What is it, Blake?"-

Blake blushed now for reasons he didn't understand, and he muttered -"Can you release my hand now?"- Besides this, it hurt slightly, and it made Blake's hand numb, as Joana didn't control her strength properly. Joana blushed as well, and noticed Blake dissimulated pain, and felt bad about herself, her parents had told her her chances with any guy were low if her alien nature was found, but even if not, she now thought that her strength might hurt people she didn't mean to...

-"I remembered I got two tickets for a movie... I wondered if you'd go with me..."-

-"Uh..."- Blake scratched the back of his head nervously, and also, he noticed in Joana's look that she wouldn't accept a 'No' this time... He had used it too many times by now... -"What time will it be?"- Blake asked, then Joana, with a happy expression, checked the tickets

-"It's on Wednesday, 5.30 PM..."-

-"I guess I'll be there then..."- Blake answered, but Joana read him like a book, and said

-"I still want to hang out after class anyway..."-

Blake would've slammed his forehead against the table if Joana wasn't there. He wanted to avoid trouble and other people's attention, but being with Joana was doing the opposite... Not that he could blame her... But he feared he wouldn't be able to defend himself, and would get another beat-up... (Well, he didn't get beaten up, but he still got heavy damage)

-"Alright..."- Blake said, and could almost hear funeral music, and shut his mind up, thinking 'It's not like I would have a funeral anyway... nobody would attend....'

The bell rang, and Blake was somewhat relieved, and tried not to think about what would happen when he was alone. They had Biology class and in the middle of it, it was heard the principal requesting Blake to go to his office, and he muttered

-"Why me?"- He asked the teacher for permission and walked outside the classroom, most of the male students had an evil grin, thinking Blake was getting what he deserved, some of them even muttered 'That's Karma for you!!'
15311111111111111111.title: Still, Blake decided to leave later...

choices: Back to Joana and her family...
153111111111111111111.content:
Blake entered silently to the principal's office

-"Good afternoon, Blake. There are some things we need to discuss... Please take a seat"- The principal said, and Blake did so, still silent, expecting something bad to happen. Probably the fight he got into... He sighed, and expected some angry yelling, but instead, the principal asked

-"I was visited by a government's agent. When checking students' information, it highlighted yours because you have no legal guardian..."-

Blake opened his eyes wide... He had worked a lot to get the money to get registered at the school (At least where I live it actually costs) and knew his grandma was dead, but had no other choice, as he didn't want to be sent to some sort of orphanage (At 16 years old he was a bit too old for that) or some random adoption. Now he knew he was screwed

-"You need a living legal guardian, Blake... Don't you have any other relatives?"-

-"No sir."- Blake didn't know what else to say. The principal noticed his silence, he wouldv'e liked to hear something more from him, as his files had very little information about him. He had no involvement in any extracurricular nor club activities. The only other thing reports showed was that he only interacted with Joana, as she was the only person he worked with for paired or teamworks. But he also felt that he shouldn't push him because probably his family's death was probably a delicate subject

-"Normally students with no legal guardian are not allowed to study... But I'll make a temporary exception. You're actually a good student. I'll give you a week to get someone to be your legal guardian..."-

-"A week?"-
