1533.content:
[Note: This is an ALTERNATE telling of Bleach... I hope that explains almost everything, it's in some cases heavily modified from the original story... Not recommended for purists...]

This story starts 15 years after Ichigo Kurosaki was born, and 2 months before classes started. It was an ordinary summer day at Karakura Town... Another 15 years old guy was wandering around the town's streets, seemingly without anything else to do. He was 180 cm tall, had tanned skin, and black wavy hair. And was wearing a black open jacket, with a light gray shirt under it, as well as black jeans and tennis shoes.

Additional to all this, he always wore a silver chain around his neck, with two small silver charms, a chinese symbol for "light" (like this http://www.goldenjewelrystore.com/images... ) as well as a wing ( http://d200fahol9mbkt.cloudfront.net/ite... ). These had been given by his mother and his father in his 13th birthday, though he wore the chain since he was 5 years old...

Back to what he was doing, well, he was just wandering around, walking to no specific place, while thinking about many things, walking somewhat helped him to think and to relax. Until suddenly, he crouched, and two thugs crashed against each other in mid air, they had intended to take him by surprise. The guy simply resumed walking until one of them shouted

-"Don't think you'll escape that easily!! You WILL pay for what you've done!!"- He and the other thug charged toward the guy, who hit both of them in the stomach with his elbows, without even turning around or looking, and quickly, caught a third thug's fist, and punched him in the stomach as well. He walked away, saying no word, and leaving three teenager bullies writhing in pain...

From some distance, a strawberry teenager, along a tall dark skinned and brown haired one watched the whole scene, the strawberry blond said

-"I thought we were the only ones with trouble with those guys..."-

-"No... Blake has been fighting them as often as us if not even more often..."-

-"Really? How do you know his name, Chad?"- The strawberry blond asked

-"Because he IS in our class, Ichigo"- Chad replied -"Never noticed him, huh?"-

-"Nope..."- Ichigo scratched the back of his head

-"He doesn't talk very much..."- Chad added, and Ichigo raised an eyebrow, and said

-"If you say that, it means the guy doesn't talk at all..."- Ichigo and Chad laughed at the joke, then Ichigo added -"But he's popped out of nowhere in our fights some times... and whenever I asked him, he just would say he passed by..."-

-"Maybe he tries to be friendly?"- Chad said

-"I don't know, Chad, I don't know..."- Ichigo and Chad kept walking, they were just walking on their own as well, and talking about a lot of stuff. Although he always had a weird feeling when Blake was near...

Meanwhile, Blake, who was just wondering what to do, stared at the sky, it was blue, with no clouds. Nobody else knew, but he had been able to see "ghosts" or the souls of the dead. Not only that, but he also learned that there existed also "evil ghosts" as well, which always tried to devour him or the dead souls. He had also learned that he could transform into a ghost himself, leaving his body behind. He was determined to help the dead people and protect them from the monsters, and also found that he could send those souls to heaven, by touching their heads with his hand...

However, some of the monsters he fought were capable of talking, and some of them kept saying "Murderer!! Murderer!! You have no right to kill your own kind!!" Blake, as very young child, was confused by the statement, but didn't let the doubts get the best of him and went on to exterminate any monster he encountered. He thought it was probably just some trick to make him doubt and be devoured.

Some other monsters would question his actions, saying "Who gave you the right to judge us?" "Who are you to say eating souls is wrong?" and such. Blake determined to not feel any sort of mercy to the monsters anyway, specially after seeing the horror in the faces of dead souls he wasn't able to save... He felt that it had to be horrible to be eaten like that, to an extent he couldn't probably understand...

He had noticed that when he was out of his body, his clothing changed to a white open jacket, with a black shirt under it. He also had a white hakama, black tabi (japanese socks) and white zori, quite strange as Blake would know these are clothes from older times. But he didn't really mind, as nobody could see him other than the dead souls and the monsters. Blake also found that he had a small hole in his wrist. It bothered him because it looked like the holes he found in the monsters he fought.

As he grew up, his abilities had grown stronger, and even in his body, he was able to destroy the monsters, although he preferred to not use it, so he couldn't be seen. Which also helped, because one day, about 5 years ago, he had a strange dream with voices calling him, and woke up with two swords in his hands. Two nodachi, to be more accurate, with golden hilts, and circular tsuba (handguard), one of them silver, and the other one golden, both of them had an heptagram symbol in relief ( http://0.tqn.com/d/altreligion/1/0/h/1/-... ).

The one with golden tsuba, had a kanji symbol, in gold, although non relief, on its right side, ( http://www.xnvx.com/data/thumbnails/89/J... ) which was read "Death". The one with silver tsuba had a different kanji, in slight relief ( http://www.davidhed.com/blog/wp-content/... ) which read "Angel". Blake didn't get what they really meant, but he found the weapons weren't visible to people, and that they were effective to kill the monsters. So, his fighting style adopted the use of two swords, though Blake was self-taught on the matter, and developed his own style.

Seeing dead souls, and facing the monsters in continuous fights were things that stressed Blake to some degree, and he increased the frequency of his walks, to seek some relief for his mind. He felt like he was carrying a great weight on his shoulders, and he had found none of the answers for his questions. He kept wondering on all this, when he was forcefully snapped out of it when he got struck by something from above. Blake was really surprised that something caught him off guard like that, and then found it was not something, but someone... a girl...

-"What the hell?"- Blake mumbled, and noticed nobody could see the girl, and people thought he had tripped. He didn't really know what to do, but the girl probably was another dead soul, and so, he decided to carry her over his shoulders (not that anybody would notice) and walked to his house. He put her on his bed and waited for her to wake up, and in the mean time, Blake decided to stay at his room (to protect her in case another monster appeared), and play some videogames while waiting, as he was usually alone for most of the day. Now that Blake noticed, the girl had fair skin, brown hair, was dressed like him as a ghost... with black tabi, white zori sandals, a white hakama, and a white jacket as well...

'Creepy...' Blake thought, and what scared him a bit was that she was like him, except for the hole in the wrist, nor she had any sword. ' I'll definitively ask this girl some questions' Blake thought. This had to be the strangest thing that happened to him in his entire life, and he of most people had seen many really strange things...
1533.title: Another new beginning...

choices: -"What dream?"- He heard Joana's voice, and saw her sitting next to him...
15331.content:
After about two hours, the girl slowly woke up, and found herself on a bed, and noticed a guy was near, playing some videogames. She had hit her head really hard, and it hurt a lot. She couldn't remember anything, except that she was trying to escape to the human world from something... She sat up and rubbed the back of her head a little. Blake was the ifrst one to speak

-"Finally you woke up..."-

-"Uh... excuse me, how long was I... unconscious?"- The girl asked, and Blake looked at his room's clock

-"About 2 hours..."-

-"Oh... And... could you tell me where am I?"-

-"You're still in the real world..."- Blake seemingly got what she meant, and he replied, thinking she was just another dead soul.

-"The real world? You mean the human world?"- The girl asked, and Blake raised an eyebrow... 'What other world could be the real one? Unless she means, heaven?' he thought

-"Uh... last time I checked, yeah..."- Blake replied with some sarcasm, but he also knew that if she was recently dead, it meant she was probably in shock, but he needed to ask his questions

-"Do you remember what happened to you before falling unconscious?"-

-"No... I only remember I was escaping from something... then nothing... and my head hurts..."- The girl replied

-"I'd give you an aspirin but that doesn't work on ghosts..."- Blake kinda apologized

-"Ghosts?"-

-"Yeah, you ARE a ghost... normal people can't see you..."-

-"You're one too?"- The girl asked, Blake laughed briefly, and said

-"Nope. I'm just a weird human that can see ghosts..."-

-"Oh..."- The girl didn't know what else to say

-"By the way, my name is Blake..."- He added. The girl was seemingly confused, and Blake added -"You can call me that. I don't really like to be called by my family name..."-

Just then, almost randomly, a lots of memories flashed in her mind, where she could see she was called Joana by others... She blinked twice, and replied

-"Joana... my name is Joana..."-

-"You just remembered it, didn't you?"- Blake had a great ability to read other people, despite not showing much emotion himself. He only seemed to care for the dead souls, as he felt he didn't fit in human teenagers' groups. Nor that he really wanted to. The girl nodded in response, and Blake said

-"Good. It's a good sign. You might recover sooner than I thought"- Despite being 15, Blake had a lot of medical knowledge from reading, and had learned some things from the ghosts he had helped... Just then, Blake instinctively pushed Joana off the bed, and when she sat up to ask why he did such a thing, she saw that Blake was stopping a strange monster with his hands... he had pushed her so the monster didn't hurt her...

She felt completely powerless, and looked in horror, as Blake's skin started to show signs of burning. Blake kicked the monster in the face, off the house's 2nd floor. He said to her

-"Stay here!! If another monster comes just shout..."- Blake himself jumped off the 2nd floor, landing in his house's backyard, while the monster roared angrily, then, it spoke

-"Stupid!! I'll eat you both anyway!!"-

-"I'm sorry, I've been told I have a bad taste"- Blake replied with sarcasm, and said to the monster -"Bring it on!!"- The monster, which was navy blue, with a white wolf shaped mask, with red horizontal stripes on the left side, and seemingly made of bone, dashed toward Blake (in fours, completely wolf-like), who dodged him and kicked him in the back.

The monster quickly turned around and tried to attack Blake by biting (similar to how a real wolf does) And Blake stopped his jaws with his hands, although they were burning, and even some smoke was visible... Unknown to him, Joana was watching them, and felt terrible when she noticed Blake's hands were burning. He didn't seem to mind too much, as he kept punching the monster's mask, but before Blake gave what seemed to be the finishing blow, other 3 monsters appeared, all wolf like, but differently colored and with different complexions (some were smaller and thinner, others taller but still thinner, and some heavier ones)

They made a horrible roar that sounded like a dying wolf, and then they all attacked Blake at the same time. It looked like it was a total carnage, and the blue wolf-like monster emerged from the chaos, with Blake in his mouth, as a sinister prize. Joana couldn't help but let some tears drop, and felt very bad, because she caused the guy who helped her to die. But then she heard his voice, and noticed Blake was still alive, and shoved his fist down the blue wolf-like monster's throat, choking him, and forcing him to release him.

Blake then, barely standing, said -"You ASKED for it!!"- He fell unconscious, and the monsters started to laugh, until one of them, a green and thinner one, was suddenly sliced in two, and Blake, with different clothing, was standing behind him, with a sword unsheathed. The wolves looked at the lying body in confusion, and the leader, the blue one said

-"Wait!! No chain of fate!! What the hell is wrong with this thing?!!"-

Another wolf was sliced in two, and Blake, without looking, fired from his hand what looked like a red energy ball, exploding in contact against the monster's face, and shattering its mask, as well as its head. The two remaining monsters, a red one, besides the blue one, got on two feet and tried to smash Blake down with their fists, but Blake stopped both of them with a single hand, and cut the red one horizontally, the blue one just got a bad wound. And growled very angrily

-"I won't forgive this, I will...!!"- Blake disappeared before his eyes, and before he could finish the phrase, he was beheaded from behind. Blake swiftly sheathed the sword (a nodachi) and walked toward his body. Then Joana jumped off the second floor and ran toward Blake, who was aiming his hand at his body

-"Who are you?"- She asked

-"I told you, Blake..."-

-"I mean, who are you really?"-

-"Just a guy that helps dead souls..."- Blake answered, while still aiming his hand at his body, and gathering small blue particles, and she asked

-"What's that?"-

-"Energy. I can gather it and use it to heal either myself or others..."- Blake replied, and the wounds in his physical body healed rather quickly, then, Blake put his body on like it was some type of clothing, and blinked once, then added

-"Good as new"- Blake opened and closed his hands a few times, confirming this. Then, a metallic sounding horrendous roar was heard, and Blake sighed

-"Could you take care of it? It seems there are some more ghost bullies that need to be kicked really hard..."- Blake went out of his body once again, and Joana opened her eyes wide because now that she was closer, she noticed his clothes were nearly identical to hers, except that he wore the jacket open, while hers was more like a long sleeved blouse, although both jackets were long tailed.

Another hollow appeared from what seemed to be a dark portal, and it had a feline-like mask, but very muscular, and large (standing on two feet at 9'10"). It also had very long, thick and sharp claws, It immediately tried to slash Blake with them, but he stopped the strike with his sword, and using his free hand, cut the monster's hand, revealing a second sword, apparently identical to the first one. The monster roared and its hand reformed... Blake had seen that many times, but it disturbed him tat he had the same ability...

Because of that brief moment of distraction, the monster was able to punch Blake and send him a few meters away, although Blake was able to stop instead of being knocked down, and dashed toward the monster, which tried to bite Blake, but failed to realize that Blake had already planned the move, and pierced his head through his open mouth, finishing off with a beheading strike from his other sword, the monster started to dissolve into particles, and Blake sheathed his swords after swiftly removing the blood from them. His body started to get healed. Joana was still hugging his body tightly, and when Blake came back, she ran and gave him a hug...

Well, she thought she gave him a hug... Blake could only feel everything inside him cracking, and said, with the few air that hadn't been knocked out of him

-"...Let...go...please..."- The few minutes Joana was hugging him seemed like an eternity, and when she released him, he fainted, much to Joana's own dismay. About half of an hour later, he woke up, in his room, and mumbled

-"What a crazy dream!!"-
15331.title: Weirdest day in Blake's life, part 2...

153311.content:
-"Oh my... it was real..."-

A thorough self-healing later...

-"Why didn't you tell me you had powers?"- Blake asked

-"I don't remember anything... I didn't know..."- Joana said with an apologetic tone -"I didn't know I had such strength..."-

-"That was insane... None of the monsters I've fought are that strong..."- Blake added, but noticed Joana was feeling bad for it, and put a hand on her shoulder -"Don't worry. I guess it's not a bad thing, heh... next time, you can send those things to hell in a single slap"- Blake said with a smile because of the joke, but Joana realized it was the first time she had seen him smile, and in a lighter mood than before. She playfully pushed him aside with the least strength possible, but still pushed him off the bed, which led to Blake's inevitable "Ouch!!"

Joana immediately helped him to get up, and he said -"You have to work on that strength of yours..."- She just looked away in slight embarrassment, then she asked

-"How did you know the monster was going to attack us?"-

-"Fast reflexes... After fighting them for over 10 years, I got used to it..."-

Joana knew Blake said the truth, as he previously killed all those monsters with ease. Then, she asked

-"Um... did you notice... your clothes were like mine?"-

-"I was going to ask the same exact question..."- Blake replied -"The only thing I know is that I've been always to see both good and evil ghosts, and have the power to face the latter ones... I don't know what it is, or where does it come from..."-

Then Joana trembled a little, and Blake was surprised by this

-"What's wrong?"-

-"Something... is coming..."-

-"Damn..."- Blake got out of his body once again, and he said, partially in a joking tone

-"Please, no bear hugs, I've just fixed that body, and it's the only one I have..."- He jumped to the roof, and noticed several dark holes opening in the air, and more monsters were coming out of them. These ones had many different appearances, but all of them had a hole -usually in the chest- and a bone mask with different designs. Joana could hear the swords' swinging.

It took Blake a few minutes, but he finished off a dozen of monsters. He sheathed his swords once again and jumped down to his room.

-"Geez, those monsters really have a thing for you..."- He said, and then he remembered, one of the times he was talking to a spirit he was helping...

-"What does attract these things?"- A then 10 years old Blake asked

-"Spiritual energy. These things will go after anyone with higher spiritual than the rest... naturally, since all dead people are made of it, these things will go after us instead of the living... and even among us, those who have more spiritual energy are the most chased..."- A wise old man's spirit replied

'So... her power is attracting them...and there are good chances mine do as well...' He thought, and Joana hadn't said a word because she noticed he was thoughtful for a moment

-"Nevermind..."- Blake said -"Do you have any idea about where did you come from?"-

-"No"- Joana replied -"I just remember escaping from something... and then I woke up here..."-

-"Alright... Well... Uhh... Do yo have a place to sleep?"- Blake asked

-"No... Not really..."- She looked down in some embarrassment, Blake sighed, and said

-"You can sleep here if you want..."-

-"Really?"- She hugged him again, and then she heard bones cracking, and released Blake, who muttered

-"So... much... pain..."- Before he fainted, and after some seconds he got out of his body once again, and said -"You know, you really have to stop doing that..."- He healed his body and in a few minutes, he got inside it again. He didn't notice but Joana had blushed slightly, and she got even redder when he said

-"Well, there's the bed..."- She started to stutter, until she noticed Blake went to his closet, and got out something that looked like a net, and she noticed a hook in a wall, and another one in the opposite one. Blake set it up rather quickly, and said

-"Don't worry. I always sleep on this... I never got used to beds..."- Blake just got onto the hammock, for now, he was sitting on it, and said to Joana -"Before going to sleep, I'll just explain you the rules if you'll stay here..."-

-"Rules?"-

-"Nothing too complicated, just don't do anything stupid. As I've told you, you're invisible to people, so, if you do anything such as grabbing an object, people will, I repoat, WILL freak out... Just stay in my room while I'm not here... Also, don't talk to people, they won't hear you, nor touch them, because that will scare them as well. Understood?"-

-"But if I'm alone, what if another monster appears?"-

-"You have a good point... I'll think about it. Tomorrow I'll see what can we do about that... Good night"- Blake laid in his hammock, and closed his eyes. Joana went to the bed and decided to sleep as well. She was surprised that Blake didn't really mind she was sleeping in the same room, nor that he let her stay rather easily... But she knew those things would keep her from sleeping, so, she relaxed and fell asleep.

Some hours later, she woke up, and it was morning already. Blake was still sleeping, and for some reason, she just smiled, and lied back on the bed. Some minutes later, Blake woke up, and after a brief greeting, he went to wash his face and have some breakfast. After he was done, he went back upstairs, and asked Joana about what she was going to do...

-"I don't know..."-

-"Are you sure you aren't dead?"- Blake asked

-"I don't know..."- She replied, then Blake got up, and put his hand on her forehead, and his hand started to glow in blue light

-"Let's try..."- However, after a moment, nothing happened, and Blake was surprised, then he tried with both hands over her forehead, and mumbled

-"Go to Heaven..."- However, nothing happened, and after a moment, Blake stopped, and said in a confused tone -"This is the first time that doesn't work... So, I guess you're not dead..."-

-"That's good?"-

-"I guess... it's more weird than good though..."- Blake said, with a thoughtful look -"However, this is just riskier, as you're a free soul, and the monsters will keep trying to eat you..."-

-"Oh..."-

-"You seem to have some powers. So, I'll teach you to defend yourself..."- Blake got out of his body, and put it in the hammock, like he was still sleeping. Then, he said -"Follow me"-

They jumped off the second floor, and started walking. Now that she was close to him, she noticed Blake had his 2 swords sheathed. After about half an hour, they walked into an abandoned factory, and Blake said

-"There's no people here. This is the ideal place to train..."- Blake then added -"Since you don't have a sword, I'll teach you hand to hand combat"- Just for a brief moment, Blake questioned himself about teaching a girl he just met, yet again, he knew that he couldn't let the monsters eat another soul...

He started with the basic stuff, such as stances (Blake's fighting style was self taught, and developed in order to fight back both at the monsters and the bullies at school). Then they tried a sparring match, but Blake was dumbfounded when Joana was able to dodge him effortlessly, and when he finally could land a hit on her, it did nothing, and his hand hurt instead. She had a worried look, and he said

-"Don't worry about this. Keep fighting..."-

She kept on dodging because she was afraid of further hurting him, and when she blocked, and Blake's fist hit her forearm, the bones cracking could be heard, and she stopped the training. Blake started to gather energy and his hand healed in a few seconds. Then they resumed, but with the same results, Blake asked

-"What the hell? Are you made of iron or what?"- Joana shrugged in answer. Blake decided to try something riskier, and without warning, he sheathed one of his swords, and tried to hit Joana, and even more strangely, she stopped the tip of the blade with just two fingers!! Blake dashed backwards to get some distance, and tried again, this time, the sword clashed against her left forearm, which she used to block. Instead of blood, the sword's clash created a lot of sparks, and sounded as if it had hit solid steel. Blake now had a O_O face, and muttered

-"What the hell did I get myself into?"- Then, he sheathed the sword, and he said -"You said you couldn't fight!! How come you move faster than me, and not even the swords can hurt you?!!"-

-"I don't know, I swear..."- Joana said apologetically, Blake sighed, and resumed on hand to hand combat, although he found difficult to teach someone faster and seemingly stronger than himself. They trained for at least 6 hours more (They had gotten up at 8:00 AM, and went to rain at 9.00 AM, so, it was about 3.00 PM when they were done). Joana apologized many times, because she thought Blake was mad at her, despite he said it was ok. When they got outside the factory, Blake noticed more holes in the air, which only meant the monsters had followed them.
153311.title: It was NOT a dream...

1533111.content:
This time, Blake told Joana to fight them as her "homework" for the day. She engaged in fight against them, and was able to shatter their masks in single hits. She could even slice one of them with a kick. And their hits and attempts to bite had no effect on her. However, the last standing monster was somewhat tal, and Joana was at level with his chest hole, and she seemed to fall into some sort of trance, which the monster took advantage of, hitting her in the stomach, and throwing her away. Blake quickly drew his sword and sliced the monster vertically. Then he ran to where Joana was, and said

-"What the hell happened?!!"-

-"Hollows..."- She said, seemingly still in the trance

-"What?!!"-

-"Hollows..."- She said again, and Blake thought he referred to the monster's hole, and that seemingly all of them had one. He then tried to wake her up, or snap her out of it, but she seemed to be still on that, until she closed her eyes and fell unconscious. Blake had no other option than to carry her over his shoulders, back to his house. Good thing both were invisible... well, that's what he thought...

Unaware of the possibility of being seen, Blake walked past a cafe, carrying the girl over his shoulders, and ichigo, who was hanging out with Tatsuki and Chad, nearly choked on his drink, and when they asked what was going on, he said he just breathed in a wrong moment. Although, Ichigo didn't really see who was, but seeing a guy in white weird clothes carrying a girl similarly clothed, and his knowledge telling him that they were probably ghosts, still shocked him. He also noticed that the guy had a sheathed sword...

'Creepy' That's all he thought, and resumed hanging out with his friends, though he wasn't fully relaxed anymore, well, he had been stressed for long, but he got even more stressed now...

As for Blake, he went back to his room, and placed Joana on the bed, and waited for her to wake up again. This time he didn't ply videogames, as he wasn't in the mood, and was actually tired from the training. His body ached a bit because of it, and went to get something to eat. 30 minutes later, Blake was already done, and Joana woke up again

-"Please, don't tell me you've just forgotten everything..."- Blake said

-"Huh? No!! I just... got knocked out, or something..."-

-"You were like in some sort of trance..."-

-"Really?"-

-"Yeah. I'm sorry, I guess I shouldn't have made you fight them this early... It seems that the monster's appearance scared you..."-

-"Why do you say that?"-

-"Because you stared at the hole in its chest, and then you got into that trance, and even said 'Hollows... hollows...'. I never thought that would be so traumatic, yet again, I'm not a normal guy to tell..."- And Joana looked at nowhere, thoughtfully, then, she snapped her fingers, and said

-"It was not that... Memories flashed in my mind... and I remembered... the hollows..."- Blake had a further confused look, and Joana added -"Hollows, that's what you call monsters... they are souls with no heart,,, that's what the hole in their chests mean..."-

-"Whoah, stop it right there!!"- Blake said -"How do you know so much about them?!"-

-"I don't know... I just remembered that..."-

-"So, you were pursued by hollows before getting knocked and losing your memories?"-

-"Nope. I don't remember clearly, but what was pursuing me weren't hollows. They were something else..."-

-"Alright... I guess I shouldn't press on the matter..."- Blake said. Now he had more questions... the monsters, called hollows, have said he was one of them more than once, and he knows he's always had a hole in his left wrist... 'What does all that mean? Am I really one of them? Does this hole mean I have no heart?' Blake knew he was never an emotional person, and that he was rather cold to people except for the dead souls... He always had the feeling he was more like them than like the living...

Then again, he questioned why he didn't look like a monster, nor was trying to eat souls like the rest. He needed to know those answers, and if Joana remembers more, then he might have them. Until then, he could use some some more sparring matches to get stronger. He could barely believe that his sword, which had been able to cut through solid steel, let alone, the monsters' masks, did nothing to her bare skin... And her speed... she dodged him effortlessly, and was probably holding back...

Blake wondered if that was the potential he had... maybe she was becoming too strong and the monsters or someone tried to have her killed... That could explain the more frequent attacks, but he didn't want to think further about it. He guessed the best he could do was to keep her staying at the house and eventually remember everything... and maybe teaching him how the HELL can someone not be cut by a "spirit sword" (That's how Blake called them)

-"Uh... can we do something else?"- Joana asked

-"Like what?"-

-"I don't know... I'd like to go for a walk..."- Joana said, she really didn't remember anything, and wanted to see more of the world. Blake sighed, and said

-"Fine..."- Blake liked walking, but alone. However he told himself not to say anything about it and they went downstairs and out of the house. There was a nearby park, in which Joana wanted to stop, to contemplate it. Blake climbed to a tree's branch, and Joana looked at him in confusion

-"Why are you there?"-

-"I don't like people too much..."- Blake replied plainly, and Joana climbed next to him

-"Uh..."- She watched all different kinds of living beings, like some birds, dogs and cats... although these seemed to notice her.

-"Someone once told me, that animals can see spirits... Specially dogs, and even try to warn their owners about them..."-

-"Why?"-

-"Ghosts are mostly perceived as a threat. Most people think all ghosts are harmful, and vengeful spirits which will bring death and disgrace... The presence of a ghost is never well received by people..."-

-"I see..."-

-"Of course, that's not the truth, but those stories have been passed down by legends... not all spirits are bad... Most of them are just sad, or confused..."-

'Like me?' Joana asked herself, and nodded. She also wondered who was the person who told Blake about that, but she felt that since he wasn't mentioning the person's name, he might not want to talk about it. Then, as the sun set, they noticed several teenagers sitting on benches, always paired, guys and girls. Joana was a bit curious and asked Blake about it

-"Uh... they're hanging out..."- Blake said, but Joana realized that Blake wasn't telling the truth, and asked again

-"But, why are all of them in pairs?"-

-"It's some complicated stuff you probably don't want to know..."-

-"I'll say if I don't want to know..."- Joana replied, and Blake sighed in annoyance

-"Alright... those, are 'couples'. A guy and a girl that are in a special relationship, they spend time together and go on dates..."-

-"What's a date?"- Joana asked, with honest curiosity, Blake facepalmed himself, and said

-"When a guy and a girl go together to do something... nothing in particular, just spend time together..."-

-"Like what?"-

-"Like...going for a walk together... watch the sunset... go to watch movies... I don't really know...Hell, how am I supposed to know?! I'm the least indicated person to tell you about that stuff..."-

-"Why?"-

-"Because I've never done that, nor I'm really interested... Dates aren't the solution to my own problems..."-

-"So... if dating is that... are we going on one?"- Joana asked (strangely) innocently, but didn't hear an answer, instead, a loud thud was heard, as Blake had fallen from the tree branch, hitting his head hard. She immediately jumped from the tree branch to help him to get up. Blake said, while rubbing the back of his head

-"How do you ask such a thing?! Of course not!! You are a spirit, and I'm a human!! That would be so wrong on so many levels..."-

-"Why?"-

-"Because it's not right to have a relationship with a dead person!! And except for some really sick people, it's not normal..."-

-"What relationship?"-

Blake sighed in further annoyance, and answered the question

-"People that date, are implied to be in a complicated relationship that includes being 'in love', to have special feelings for each other, and many more complicated things..."-

-"What complicated things?"-

-"i can't really explain. But implies to feel affection or something for a person..."- Blake climbed back up to the tree branch, and Joana followed him.

-"Oh..."-
1533111.title: Joana and Blake go out (Not in the dating sense)

15331111.content:
-"I was told that those things can only be truly understood by the ones who have experienced it themselves. That's why I can't really describe what it is... Anyway... maybe when we find how to send you to heaven, you would learn there more than I could ever tell you..."-

-"And why don't you go on dates?"- Joana asked, blushing a bit, now knowing what it really meant, and Blake gave him an annoyed look ¬_¬

-"Look at me. I'm a guy, who can turn into a ghost, and I'm on a tree's branch, talking to a dead spirit..."-

-"So what?"- Joana noticed, looking at him, that he had a scar, a straight line that ran down across his left eye. It was a clean line, and was about 3 inches long, nearly perfectly centered with the eye... Aside that, she also noticed that Blake's eyes seemed to reflect tiring... and not tiring from not sleeping well... a deeper tiring, like he was tired of everything...

-"I'm not a normal guy, let alone, one that any girl would go out with... That's why I don't even try... Why to pretend to be someone else? Being myself is always equal to a failure, and eventually any person will grow tired of my problems. Thus, if I cannot be myself, why bother trying?"-

-"But, aren't you lonely because of that?"- Joana had already seen some sort of loneliness in Blake's eyes before, like a silenced grief. He was obviously repressing it, and despite she didn't remember many things, she could see Blake's own emotions, something everyone else failed at.

-"Who cares? I don't... I've always been alone, it's not something new to me..."- Blake replied, more annoyed, and Joana felt that he was lying, and that he wasn't telling her something, however, they've practically just met, so, she decided to stop pressing on the subject...

-"I didn't know the sunset was this beautiful... All I remember is night..."- She commented. Blake found this a bit strange. Even for a dead person, day and night should be a normal thing... That and the fact that she had similar clothes to his own, and was seemingly more powerful than himself rang a "caution" alarm in his mind. He thought he better watched out for anything weird...

-"Do you remember anything else?"- Blake still wanted to know more about where did she come from to answer his own questions

-"Not much... just night... and a forest... a dark forest..."- Joana was really struggling to remember anything she could

'I really hope she isn't one of those girls that were murdered by those psycho serial killers...' Blake had slight suspicions on the way Joana died... 'Yet, that doesn't explain why do I have the weird seeing ghosts and fighting monsters thing... Unless... No... Even if I were adopted... I shouldn't be dead and alive at the same time, it's not possible...'

-"I can't remember more. Everything else is dark and vague... maybe with some more time I'll remember other things..."-

-"Yeah..."- Blake knew it was implied she was going to stay with him, as she had nowhere else to go... And Blake, despite his usually cold attitude, couldn't send an innocent to die... specially someone who seemed to share some traits with him... which made everything a whole lot weirder and more complicated... Blake had never bragged, nor even shown openly, but he's very smart for someone his age.

As he almost doesn't talk to others at all, only his test results reveal his intellectual level. However, when it was about spirits, it was way more difficult to understand, and Blake could only rely on what he could prove, or what he learned from people who really knew about the matter. There were many paranormal books that were just some man's own ideas... or compilations of legends that have been too distorted through time... or attempts at making fables, with some moral lesson... With the years, Blake had learned none of that was the truth, and that nobody would believe the actual truth... Bad people wasn't always punished, not good people always found salvation... Everything depended on actions... only concrete actions could change the reality...

And that's why Blake had decided to fight the hollows, no miraculous phenomenon would save the endangered dead souls, and no magic would kill the hollows out of nowhere. At least that was what he has always believed... After while, Blake snapped himself out of his thoughts, and decided to give it a rest, as he would need lots of time to find more about Joana and maybe himself. He decided to indulge himself a bit, and let himself enjoy such a simple thing as the sunset...

-"Now that I think about it... I think these things aren't appreciated enough by people because it happens everyday..."- Blake said, it was more like thinking out loud, but Joana heard him

-"Really?"-

-"Well, some people do..."-

Blake and Joana watched the sunset until it ended, and the sky became filled with stars, as every night, in Karakura town, and in every other part on the same side of the world... Blake jumped from the tree branch, and Joana did as well. They walked some more, enjoying a bit of the beauty of the night sky, until Blake saw the hour in a clock, and they rushed back to his house. Before jumping to the second floor, he said to her

-"Now, don't do anything while my parents are here..."- He went back to his body, and she laid on the bed. Blake pretended to be sleeping, and a female voice was heard

-"Blake! We're home!"-

Moments later, a knock in his door was heard, and a woman with light brown hair and aqua eyes opened the door. Blake pretended to just wake up

-"Hey, we'll have dinner soon, so, wake up, sleepyhead"- The woman said with a somewhat cute tone, and left. Blake sighed in relief

-"That was close..."- He got up and said to Joana -"That was my mother. As I've told you, don't do anything... I'll come back soon..."-

The dinner was pretty much like everyday's, although Lith commented that Blake shouldn't have been doing nothing all day, Blake said he had been going to walk outside for most of the time, and that there was nothing wrong with him having a 'day off', also, that he got the highest notes in Mashiba Jr. High and made it to the Karakura High School, coming from the Mashiba Jr. High, it was really something, as "things were mostly chaos there", as Blake said several times when referring to his days at school. James, Blake's father, agreed and said they should let Blake be for the time being.

After some minutes, Blake was done and went back to his room, and waited for a while, then Joana spoke

-"Blake..."-

-"What is it?"-

-"Uh... I feel hungry..."-

-"Huh?!"- Blake had a confused face

-"Is that wrong?"-

-"Souls aren't supposed to feel hunger..."- Blake said, remembering what other souls had told him -"And I have no idea what a soul might eat... Physical food is not possible... and there's no spiritual food..."-

-"Urgh..."- Joana curled a bit, as the hunger felt a bit painful

-"I'm sorry. I have no idea what does a hungry soul eat..."-

Just then, they heard a roar, and Blake said, annoyed

-"Again?! Damn it..."- He got out of his body, and before jumping off the second floor, he asked Joana to lock his door, just in case, and turn off the lights, so his parents think he already went to sleep... Then, he looked at a grayish bulky hollow -"Alright. I don't have time for this, let's end this quickly..."- Blake said to his enemy, and the hollow roared in response, dashing toward Blake, saying

-"You will be my midnight snack, stupid boy!!"- Blake dodged him without problem, but when he tried to unsheathe one of his swords, the hollow extended one of his arms, punching Blake without moving. Then, tried to bite Blake again, but he stopped his jaws with his left hand, and in his right hand charged a golden energy ball, and fired it, exploding in the hollow's mouth. The hollow roared, and seemingly ran away...

Blake was really surprised, and temporarily lost sight of the hollow, he unsheathed his other sword, expecting a surprise attack, instead, he heard several roars, and smaller hollows appeared, but were devoured by the first hollow that lake was fighting... Blake had never seen a hollow doing that... As far as he remembered and knew, hollows sought to devour dead souls or him, due to his powers, but he had never seen a hollow eating one of its kind...

The hollows had been attracted by the gray hollow's power, but their ambition led to their deaths, as all of them were devoured by the gray hollow, whose power started to grow, then, he dashed toward Blake, and while Blake blocked his fist, he was still pushed because of his greater strength. Blake then tried to slice him, but he topped the sword with his hand, and despite it bled, the hollow didn't let go, then, he tried to bite Blake, who blocked the hollow's jaws using his other sword. They were struggling, and Blake was a bit surprised that a hollow was giving him trouble, but after eating at least a dozen of other hollows, it didn't surprise him...

Blake felt the hollow's strength increasing, and before he could do anything else, the hollow gave a dying roar, and was shocked to find Joana biting it,,,
15331111.title: Watching the sunset...

choices: Joana tries to find if she has a hollow hole as well... much to Blake's dismay
153311111.content:
-"What the...?!"- Blake was shocked... Joana was on the hollow's back, biting the back of his neck... and quickly, she tore off a large chunk of the hollow, who desperately tried to get her off his back. Joana bit again, and the hollow gave one last dying roar, before falling to the ground, and in less than a minute there was nothing left of him...

Joana was seemingly spaced out, and suddenly she realized of what she had done, and stared at Blake, afraid of how he would react, she didn't even know why she did it... then, Blake spoke, in a serious tone

-"What was that?"-

-"I... I Don't know..."- She replied, looking down

-"I had never heard of anything that fed on the hollow monsters... I need to know, who, or what, are you?"-

-"Blake, I'm being honest, I have no idea..."-

-"I'm not buying that this time... it's obvious you're hiding something... such as, why did you eat that thing?"-

-"I don't know... I just felt hungry... and when I realized it already happened..."-

-"Fine. I'll believe you, for now..."- Blake sighed, and sheathed his swords, he started to walk back to his house, and Joana followed him, after taking a few steps, Blake's mind flashed a memory...

-"These monsters aren't as simple as you think. There exist more powerful species... which are a fusion of several monsters, which results in a hungrier, more aggressive and more dangerous beast... some of these beasts even feed on others of their kind..."-

Blake opened his eyes wide when he remembered, and quickly turned around, and sheathed his sword, pointing it at Joana's throat

-"Now I've remembered... You are one of those cannibal hollows, aren't you?"-

-"H...huh?"- Joana didn't even know what he was talking about, and the tip of Blake's sword got closer to her throat

-"So, that was the trick... you were pretending to be an innocent girl, and distract me so I fought the hollows after you, got weaker, and so you could devour me..."-

-"What? No!!"-

-"Stop lying, monster..."- Blake tried to slash at her, but she disappeared, and reappeared a few meters away. Blake dashed toward her and tried to slash her with his two swords at once, she protected herself with her left forearm, and Blake's swords couldn't cut her. Still, Blake kept hitting, each time, the blades clashed against her skin as if they were hitting solid steel. Blake dashed backward a few feet, and aimed his right hand at her.

-"Ametralladora*"- He began to shoot a barrage of golden energy balls from the tips of his fingers, Strangely, Joana wasn't dodging and only used her arms in an X shape to protect her face and chest. Her skin, not even her clothes still showed no damage, Blake growled angrily, and dashed toward her, and tried to stab her from behind, but she disappeared again. Now, she was running away, and Blake pursued her, firing his Ametralladora barrage while doing so, unknown to them, their chasing had taken them farther from Blake's house and nearer to a forest...

Blake managed to get close to her again, and tried to slice her with his swords, but his attacks only created sparks. She kept blocking, but gave Blake a look that only showed fear and sadness, while Blake's look showed anger. Joana then grabbed Blake's swords in each hand, and said quietly

-"Please, listen... I'm not one of them... the only thing I know so far is that for some reason I need to eat them to survive..."-

Blake was struggling to get his swords free, something that seemed near impossible, as Joana's brute strength was far more massive than Blake could handle, he replied

-"And who do I know you won't do the same to other souls?! Or the living?! Or me?!"-

-"I wouldn't eat you... you saved me, and offered me your room to stay despite you didn't know me..."-

Blake stopped struggling for a moment, and Joana stared into his eyes, and said

-"Please, stop this... I won't to hurt you..."-

-"I won't believe you!!"- Blake replied, and then, Joana sensed that his spiritual power started to grow stronger, and more powerful... in a few seconds, she noticed that Blake's blades had drawn blood from her hands, then, Blake, in a swift move, did a double slash, which was shaped as an X, and also, wounded Joana in the chest. Blake stuck his swords in the ground, and aimed both hands together, and fired a wide golden beam, which struck Joana point-blank, and the explosion actually caught the two of them.

After the smoke dissipated, and some fire lingered, Blake noticed that both of them were still alive, although Joana now showed some more serious burns. Blake ran toward her, grabbing one of his swords, and tried to stab her from the front, shouting

-"Die, monster!!"- Blake felt pain, and noticed, that his sword didn't pierce Joana... and that, its handle had pierced his stomach, due to the enormous strength he had used against her, yet, her skin was too hard for him to pierce, and the force made the sword bounce off, piercing her with its blunt handle... Blake then noticed, that his sword cracked, and broke, he spat out blood, and fell backward, saying

-"Damn...it... I failed... argh..."- He fell into unconsciousness, and everything went black... after an unknown amount of time, he felt he had waken up, but couldn't see anything, nor move, and realized he couldn't feel his own body... and a voice, which sounded like a higher pitched, maniacal version of his own, said

-"Don't try to kill that girl again, you heard me?"-

-"Where am I, and who the hell are you?"- Blake replied

-"You're unconscious... and I am someone who actually knows what you're doing... I'll just tell you that. The girl doesn't deserve to be treated like that, and if you keep on that, you'll suffer..."-

-"Give me 3 reasons not to kill her..."-

-"Alright, one, because I tell you, two, shall I remind you about who you are?"-

-"What's that supposed to mean?"-

-"And, three, when you wake up you'll see..."-

-"Hold it right there!! What does she have to do with what I am?!"-

The voice gave a sort of maniacal laugh while its sound slowly vanished. Blake felt like being knocked unconscious again, and when he tried to wake up, he actually woke up. He was in his room, and lying on his bed... then he sat up, and noticed that he had bandages over his abdomen. This confused him a bit, and then, he realized he wasn't alone... Joana was sitting next to him, but was looking down, and he also noticed she had been crying...

Blake had no idea about what to do or say, and he felt ashamed... after all, he got wounded because he tried to kill her, and yet, she took him back to his room, and bandaged him (he was still in spirit form). But the, he thought again, what was he supposed to do to a monster? Thinking again

'If she were really to eat me, she had the perfect chance, I was wounded and unconscious... she didn't even fight back, and has probably enough power to beat me with a single hit... Maybe I'm doing wrong... but neither I'm able to kill her nor I'll try again to... unless given a valid reason... maybe...' He concluded that he couldn't kill someone who after what happened, still saved him. Joana must have had sensed he was deeply thinking, and when he went back to reality, she asked, quietly

-"Am I... one of them?"- And cried more, Blake the noticed that his swords were next to him, on the opposite side... one of his swords was still broken, something that had never happened as far as Blake knew... however, he pushed them off the bed, making a clanking sound Joana noticed, and Blake put his hand over her shoulder

-"No... I thought you were, but you're not... Maybe I am the monster myself..."-

Joana stopped crying, and stared at Blake, who said

-"I can't tell what are you exactly, and being honest, I was expecting to find something about you that could help me on finding what am I...You're the first being like me I've ever found... nearly the same race..."- Blake sighed, and added -"What I'm going to tell you and show you is something I've never told anyone, it has disturbed me from the day I started fighting the hollows... and it's one of the reasons I wanted to kill you before... But... I didn't tell you all the truth about me..."-

Blake then showed her his left hand, and she then noticed a hole in his wrist, she gasped

-"Did I do that to you?!"-

-"It's been always there, and it's not a wound, nor you caused it..."- Blake sighed -"As you see, there is nothing through the hole... no traces of veins, blood, or flesh, not even attempts of regeneration, nor scars... the only thing I can compare this to is the hollow's hole..."-
